29501.name: Bop Baseball
29501.description: In this game of manual dexterity, players attempt to bat a "ball" into scoring locations on a long flat wooden board that can be between 4 to 6 feet long! The game resembles a crude pinball machine. The game also comes with a score pad, a bell, and scoring devices. The box cover states that from 1 to 9 players can play on a team.

29502.name: ABC Bingo
29502.description:
ABC Bingo Games help kids acquire valuable pre-reading skills - like alphabet and sound-letter recognition - while they play a fun game.
Players learn to identify, pronounce, and discuss dozens of words as they move their animal playing pieces along the game board. Unlike traditional bingo, ABC Bingo Games do not use a bingo caller. Instead, when players land on a game-board square, they identify the square's animal, person, or object illustration; state the first letter of the word; and, if it's on their alphabet bingo mat, cover the letter with a bingo chip. Each ABC Bingo Game also includes an illustrated Word list for extra practice or review.

29503.name: Guns and Gadgets 007
29503.description:
In addition to being a normal deck of cards, each card pictures av device from a James Bond movie (like the Q boat from "The world is not enough", or the Marine Scooter from "Thunderball") or James Bond himself (Sean Connery, George Lazenby, Roger Moore, Timothy Dalton, Pierce Brosnan).

Each card also denotes unique values for six variables for the creature on the photo (Damage, Protection, Ingenuity, Stealth, Technology and Multi-purpose). Each player play their top card, and the starting player selects variable. The player with highest value wins the card and is the next rounds starter.

The game separates from other similar card games by having a secret message (e.g. name of next mission card) on the back of every Bond-card, only visible when seen trough a red plastic lens, which goes with the game.

29504.name: Tak Tics
29504.description:
Game number 5370 from Eberhard Faber, this game
"Combin(es) the skill of both chess and checkers with a new and tantalizing element of chance."
The board is an elongated checkerboard of two distinct colouring patterns, with several zones added in the centre and some out-of-bounds zones. Each player is provided with 10 pawns, which have movement rules similar to bishops in chess. An element of chance is introduced through dice rolling as well.

The box title is TAK TICS, while the Rule Book is labeled TAC TIKS

29505.name: Monopoly: Banking
29505.description:
This Version of Monopoly offers the well known game play. But instead of paper money, credit cards a used. Every player has its own card, a small card reading computer resolves all payments.

The streets in this version are named after streets and places in Berlin. Monopoly Banking was the best-selling boardgame in Germany in 2006.

29506.name: Family Dice Games
29506.description:
FAMILY DICE GAMES is a plethora of dice games packaged together into one box.

-Craps
-Poker Dice
-Put & Take
-Bowling
-Jack Pot
-Liar's Dice
-Ship, Captain, Mate & Crew
-Twenty One
-Aces
-Sequences
-Snake Eyes
-Horse
-King Nero
-Down & Back
-Strike Three

The set features a Yahtzee style dice cup, a set of five multicolored poker dice, five multicolored casino dice, five green d6, and ten green six-sided dice with a bowling pin on one face, and two six-sided dice for the game Put & Take, which bear a combination of letters and numbers on their sides.

Score sheets for the bowling game were included, as well as small poker chips for the games King Nero, Liar's Dice, and Twenty-One.

29507.name: That's Right, That's Wrong!
29507.description: That's Right, That's Wrong! is an educational/family question-and-answer game for kids by author Alan Katz. Main goal of the game is to win points by providing the WRONG answer to a trivia question (out of a choice of two answers). Each set includes 298 multiple-choice trivia questions (plus 16 extra-hard special questions). Length of game varies with number of players. Game can be played solo (to see how fast one gets to 3 points) or in groups of any number.

29508.description:
This is the successor of the highly successful game of KARGO from the same company, in this edition in the line of the "Double feature Games".

Game consists of 54 illustrated cards: 29 distance cards, 12 putt cards, 1 holed out card and 12 hazard cards. As second feature added is a distance indicator chart and 4 numbered, very tiny golfballs (4 mm diameter).

Object of the game is to get the ball into the Hole in the least number of turns.

Gameplay is the same as in Kargo: Players try to drive their ball and in the meantime to hinder the opponent to do so. Special rules apply for using which wood or iron in certain situations , the same goes for the hazard cards and their counterplays. Driven distances are marked with the golfballs on the indicator chart.
Further added is a list of real golfcourses and their distances to play for the competitors.
29508.name: Card Golf

29509.name: Alligator Game
29509.description:
Spin the spinner and feed the gator.... It'll be stuffed sooner or later. Feed it a tiny too much food..... its jaws snap shut. In a furious mood.. then you're out... you lose.... too bad. It's fun to make a gator mad.

Avoid being the one to make the alligator snap his jaws by carefully choosing whether to feed it more food or try and take food from its open mouth.

29510.description:
The expansion contains 3 separate modules, which can be combined in many ways:


New Beginnings adds 40 new utility, people and animal cards, providing players with new elements to keep the game new and exciting.
The Three Huts add 3 new huts for each player to use throughout the game, giving each additional options on each turn.
The Relic adds 4 cards, which offer players an additional way to win the game.


Expands:

Jambo




2 players, Ages 10 and up; length: 30 minutes; author: Rüdiger Dorn.
29510.name: Jambo Expansion

29511.name: Battle Recall Card Game
29511.description: Trivia game. Players score by correctly answering questions concerning American Revolutionary War, American Civil War, World War I, World War II, Korean War and Vietnam War.

29512.name: Jimbo's 99
29512.description:
"Jimbo's 99" is published in 1976 and therefore a predecessor of "O'NO 99" (BGG game 7803), because the rules are exactly identical:

You must avoid passing 99 points or you loose the round and thus 1 of your 3 tokens. The last player with remaining tokens wins the game.
Different from O'NO 99 is the deck of 52 cards. In Jimbo's 99 there are 4 suits (compared to 3 in O'NO 99) and only 16 special cards (compared to 30).

The special cards here are:
- 4 x "Reverse"
- 4 x "Hold"
- 4 x "Minus 10"
- 4 x "99"

That means that the "Ten" and "Double Play" cards were added later.

29513.name: Modern Chess
29513.description:
A Chess variant similar to Ministers Chess, yet different. The board is 9x9 and there are 36 pieces, including another pawn for each side and a new piece called a Minister. There is also a standard Queen flanking the king, with the Minister located immediately on the King's opposite side.

The Minister combines the move of the Knight and Bishop, choosing to move one way or the other each time, but not both simultaneously. This is a unique addition to the game, and is a great complement to the Queen's movement. In this way the game is different from Minister's Chess, and considerably so as a result.

Minister's Chess has the 9x9 board and adds a pawn and another Queen to each side, but renames the Queen piece to Minister. However, all Ministers move just like the standard Queen.

29514.name: The Bowl Game
29514.description:
Due to its simple rules and ease of playing, "The Bowl Game" is a perfect party game for mixed groups of non-gamers.

Much like the parlor game "Celebrity", players are broken into teams and given slips of paper. Each player writes down a set number (usually 10) of 'things' on slips of paper. These 'answers' are folded up, placed into a bowl (or hat or cup, whatever you have handy), and the game begins. Each player is given 1 minute to draw slips of paper, one at a time, and try to get their teammates to guess the answer. Much like Taboo, no charades (hand gestures) may be used, and no rhyming or "starts with" is allowed.

The "things" written can be anything that makes sense, and can be conveyed. Expressions, quotes, famous people, things, etc. As long as it's not nonsense, it's appropriate.

When the timer goes off, the team gets one, and only one guess, as to what the last answer was. The teammates must confer, and come up with a guess. Usually there's a time limit to this. If it's guessed correctly, it's a point, otherwise it's tossed back in the bowl.

The bowl is then passed clockwise, and the next person gets a turn.

Continue until the bowl is empty.

29515.name: Simplified War Game
29515.description:
Julius von Verdy du Vernois entered in the Prusian Army in 1850, he took part in the campaign on the upper Elbe and after this was promoted to the rank of lieutenant-colonel. Shortly, Verdy du Vernois became a reputed General and one of Moltke's principal assistants.
Among his works as a lecturer at the War Academy he developed a new wargame inspired in Von Reisswitz's Kriegsspiel. In the new game, Verdy du Vernois propose a free Kriegsspiel without rules manual in which the umpire is free to decide the results of players’ manoeuvres.
Simplified War Game is the American version of the original Prussian book, translated and arranged by Captain Eben Swift (Fifth Cavalry).
The book includes exercises and examples of manoeuvres on a terrain map.

29516.name: Pooh's Go-Together Game
29516.description:
This fun learning game teaches young children to group things which go together with Pooh and his friends.

Includes 36 cards, one Collector Card, and instructions.

29517.name: Konkurencja
29517.description:
Konkurencja (or 'Competition') is a humorous party game in which laughter and having fun is more important than fighting, strategy or planning.

Can you lead your shop to victory, will it be in your shop where the richest people shop? Or are you going to be stuck with the fat, stinky, or stupid ones? No one said running a shop is going to be easy...

Expanded by:

Unpublished Prototype




Home Page: http://www.startzpoleposition.com.pl/Konkurencja (Polish)

About the game (Polish): http://spiellust.blogspot.com/2007/07/konkurencja.html


Konkurencja (Konkurrenz) ist ein lustiges Spiel, in dem Lachen und Spielspaß wichtiger sind als Kampf, Strategie oder anstrengendes Planen.

Bist du im Stande, deinen Laden zum Sieg zu führen? Kannst du die meisten und dazu noch am besten reichen Kunden in dein Geschäft anlocken? Oder wirst du bloß mit dicken, dummen, ja sogar stinkenden Typen zum schwarzen Schafe deiner Branche? Niemand hat gesagt, das Leben eines Geschäftsleiters sei leicht...

Homepage des Spieles: http://www.startzpoleposition.com.pl/Konkurencja (Polnisch)

Rezension des Spieles (Polnisch): http://spiellust.blogspot.com/2007/07/konkurencja.html

29518.description: Another one in the Monopoly City themed games, this time focused on Aachen, famous for its rich historical background, and Charlemagne of course.
29518.name: Monopoly: Aachen

29519.name: Ca$h: das Eine-Million-Mark-Quiz
29519.description:
This is a quiz game based on a German TV show where (if successful) a competitor could win up to a million Deutsch Mark (the currency before Euro).

A spinner decides who is Captain of the team. Then every player spins to see on which "Action field" to put his pawn to.
Those fields may be questions but also the beginning of a Terminator round. With the latter one players can exchange their Captain. Furthermore there are actions like "spin again" or "go directly to next round" (with higher cash reward).
The money is usually distributed to equal parts amongst the players, only the Captain is getting more.

The difficulty of the trivia questions rises every round.

29520.name: Sagan om Ringen: Härskarringen
29520.description: Answer questions about the Middle Earth. A die and a card decides what question to answer.

29521.name: Battles of Oda Nobunaga
29521.description:
This game is a 2 for one, and features two famous battles by Oda Nobunaga namely the Battle of Anegawa 1570 and the Battle of Nagashino 1575.

252 Counters.

Battle of Anegawa 1570 runs for 8 turns.

Battle of Nagashino 1575 runs for 15 turns

Each units is 300 to 1000 men.

3-5 hours playing time.

29522.description:
ZOMBIES, AND GANGSTERS, AND MORE, OH MY!

"World War II, "Bug Hunts", Colonial Wars, Vietnam, "B" movies, and Al Capone. What do all these things have in common? Heavy firepower." With these words Chain Reaction burst onto the scene. Now two years later we've taken it even farther. It's a whole new ball game as Chain Reaction 2.0 Fully Loaded delivers unparalleled realism.

Now you have detailed rules for vehicles from motorcycles to heavy tanks. New weapon systems have been added as well as rules for incorporating aircraft into your games. Where once ten figures could be used now thirty or more can easily be played.

The campaign system has been enlarged to include character advancement and the addition of Skills to personalize your force. Chain Reaction 2.0 can be played solo or with others and as always WITH ANY FIGURES YOU ALREADY HAVE! So pull out those favorite figures, get ready to have some fun, and ... JUST PLAY THE GAME!
29522.name: Chain Reaction 2.0: Fully Loaded

29523.name: Tower of the Dread Mage
29523.description:
From the creator of Maze of the Red Mage:

Having escaped the clutches of the Red Mage, peace returned for a time to your lands. In the distance a black tower arose on a wind swept rocky island. Fiendish monsters issued forth into your lands and the dark sorcerer lord, the Dread Mage, sent you a challenge... "Can you survive the ten levels of my tower and defeat me, young hero?"

As evil monsters pillage your lands you have no choice but to ascend the Tower of the Dread Mage and vanquish him!

A new solitaire dungeon crawl that requires a sheet or two of graph paper, 2 six sided dice, and a pencil to play! The rules and charts are only 2 pages so take it with you and defeat the Dread Mage anywhere, anytime!

29524.description:
Expansion for the BattleTech game.

From the box cover:
"All 96 BATTLEMECHS, including the new Star League and CLANS 'MECHS described in the BATTLETECH TECHNICAL READOUT: 3050, await your command. Included are 192 full color playing pieces depicting the front and back views on heavy stock, along with card stands. Also included is a book of 96 prepared records sheets, one for each 'Mech."
29524.name: BattleTech Reinforcements 2

29526.name: The Black Community Game
29526.description:
This game teaches children about cooperation, the proper value of money, and how the Black Community works. For adults, the game provides better strategies to help the Black Community. The winner is the player that does the most for the Community. This is determined by the player with the most chips. The white chips represent economic power. The red chips represent political power. The black chips represent power in the Black Community, and the blue chips represent 10 black chips.

A player may cash in his chips at any time with blue chips worth $100 each and the other worth $10 each. A player may borrow money or chips from another player, but a player may not borrow money from the bank. A player may also trade or sell chips.

A player may move to the Suburbs or Inner City, but that player will need two players to help him move or pay part of the player's salary.
The rules state that if everybody cooperates, then everybody will prosper.

One version of the box cover states that up to 7 player can play this game and that the game is appropriate for those Ages 8 and up.

Internet information states that the game was created around 1973. The game was developed in 1973 when Malik Ali was working with high school students in Buffalo in an after-school program. He wanted to teach them how the black community works in a quick and entertaining way.

29527.name: Kampen om Riket
29527.description:
This is a game of political intrigue during medieval times in Sweden. The goal is to become crowned king of the realm.

The players take on the role of a nobleman who wants to become king.

Assassinations, crusades, black death, war, espionage and resource management is all part of this game.

Home Page: http://www.kampenomriket.se

29528.name: Notruf 112: Die Feuerwehr
29528.description: A simple roll-and-move game that tells the story of the German fire brigade using event cards.

29529.name: King Leonardo and His Subjects Game
29529.description: A very simple card game for Ages 5 - 12 with a copyright on the box - Leonardo Production Inc 1960 - for an animated television show of the times. The show focused on Leonardo, a lion, who was the inept yet well-meaning king of the fictional African nation of Bongo Congo, and his incompetent brother Itchy's attempts to overthrow Leonardo and rule the kingdom himself along with his friend (and leader) Biggie Rat, a gangster with an Edward G. Robinson-type accent

29530.name: Blood Flow
29530.description:
In this game the players race around major blood vessels gathering oxygen from the lungs and delivering it to the capillaries where it is exchanged for carbon dioxide. The cards are used to conserve oxygen by an activity such as sleeping or perhaps use it at an alarming rate due to stress. The winner of the game is the first player to return the carbon dioxide token to the lungs.

The game is recommended for children Ages 6 - 12, and its components include a game board, a dice, instructions, and token used to represent oxygen, red blood cells, and carbon dioxide.

29531.name: Bomb the Navy
29531.description:
This game uses marbles to Bomb the Navy.

The game originally came with unpunched cardboard ships with little cardboard stands, marbles, and a set of instructions.

Players roll the glass marbles to try to knock of the ships. However, it appears that some versions use projectile pellets and rubber bands with a wooden cannon instead of marbles. The number of ships also appears to vary with some editions.

The winner is the player who shoots down as many ships as possible within three shot attempts.

Most sources place the initial publishing date as 1940, but this may be only an approximate date.

29532.name: Äventyr på havet
29532.description: A light two player game that can be played from 6 years old. One player has submarines the other player Air Force, the submarine try to escape from the map while the Air Force player try to sink him.

29533.name: Die drei ??? und das brennende Schwert
29533.description:
Another in the Die Drei??? series, which are based on a popular series of books. Three detectives named Justus, Peter and Bob must solve this mystery with clever card play!

Contents
1 Gameboard
4 Pawns
27 Riddle cards
3 Detective cards
3 Game play cards
1 Game rules

29534.name: Schmuggler & Co.
29534.description: An interesting-looking game of collecting (smuggling) items of different kinds and deception to outdo your opponents. Very nice components~

29535.name: Fair Play
29535.description:
Discover the travel of cotton from the fields to the T-shirt you wear. Exchange chards and follow the thread of a production politically and environmentally correct.

Illustrations and graphics by Valeria De Caterini, editing by Claudia Piacenza.

Published in Czech, Greek, Italian, Maltese, Portoguese. In cohoperation with Ctm altromercato (Verona, Italy), Gaia Education Centre (Greece), Finis Terrae (Bari, Italy), Koperattiva Kummerc Gust (Malta), La Tortuga (Padua, Italy), Mondo Solidale (Ancona, Italy), Reviravolta (Portugal), Society for Fair Trade and Development Education (Czech Republic), Unsolomondo (Bari, Italy).

29536.name: Captain Quantum vs. The Ugly Druggies
29536.description:
This anti-drug program game for children between the ages of 8 to adolescence was "designed" by the creators of the popular television cartoon show "Ren and Stimpy."

This game was never sold in stores and was only distributed to schools. It was sponsored by the Coca-Cola company.

The game was designed to be played with an adult leader as an educator and non-player "mission navigator" who was to explain the game and encourage a discussion among the "sun troopers."

Some of the game contents include a set of instructions, a game board, six-sided dice, colorful spaceship markers, stickers, and 200 various cards.

29537.name: I.Q.:  Dr. Hagen's New True or False Game
29537.description: This game was used as an advertising game. The game had booklets which contained more than five hundred true/false questions rated according to difficulty, as well as ads for the sponsor's products (Aqua Velva After Shave). The game also included a small spinner and a game board which traced your progress from "greenhorn" to "genius" (or, if you fared poorly, to "idiot"). There were at least three different booklets of questions produced.

29538.name: Quizzical Questions by Professor Quiz
29538.description:
Extrapolated from a HSHGHP description:

This game (used as a promotional tool by Noxema) is based on a radio show of the time (Professor Quiz). The game features a large booklet with 600 questions and answers. A drab green outside box hid a beautiful gameboard inside, featuring a large wheel which would turn to reveal new questions and answers. At least two editions were produced.
Included with any purchase of a fifty cent jar of Noxzema was a promotion for this Jaymar box game.

29539.name: Wir sammeln Pilze

boardgameversion.200709: Euer Spielemännlein White Top & Bottom Edition

29539.description:
This is an former GDR-game where players roll and move over a board. On some spaces there a mushrooms and players can take another turn if it is eatable and have to go backwards for poisonous mushrooms.
Classical Roll & Move.

29540.name: Naftemporio
29540.description:
Ναυτεμπόριο (Νaftemporio) is a board game published by Greek company MIKA in 1991.

The game is a simulation of merchant shipping.It takes place in Aegean and Cretan Sea,Greece.Each player has a vessel (or two in a 2-players game) for shipping commodities (food and machinery)from city to city.But they also have to pay attention on weather,fuel management and of course to make the best deals about cargoes.

The box contains:
- Board
- 4 fuel markers
- 4 vessels
- 55 commodity tokens in six different colors
- 20 "Cargo" cards
- 20 "Port authority's announcement" cards
- 1 6-sided dice
- Paper money

29546.name: Who Knew?  The Who-What-Why Phrase Game
29546.description:
From the game box:
"Move around the Who Knew? board, landing on colors that determine what kind of question you get. Can you guess who first said the familiar phrases, what they mean or why we say them? Some of the questions may LOOK easy, but the answers just might surprise you.

Up to four players or teams.
Ages 12 and up
Playing time: 45 minutes."

29547.name: The Word 2
29547.description:
The advanced version of The Word, The Word 2 is a vocabulary game which expands the players' knowledge of vocabulary. The object of the game is to race around the board, answering questions whenever they land on "The Word" spaces or "At a Loss for Words" spaces. The first player to finish is the winner, but other players can continue the game to determine second and third place winners.

Ages 13 and up

29548.name: My First Card-Game: Colours
29548.description:
This game is really 'Quartets' using ordinary household items in distinct colours and is intended to introduce children to card games.

Players try to collect sets of four items of the same colour, by asking other players for items. The player who forms the most sets of four wins.

boardgameimplementation.170576: Saint Petersburg (second edition): New Society Completition Pack

boardgamehonor.8421: 2009 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee

29549.description:
The Saint Petersburg expansion is actually two expansions in one. It contains "The Banquet," previously available in Spielbox magazine, and the "New Society", which adds new cards, plus extra tokens to allow play with up to 5 players.

The "New Society," designed by Tom Lehmann, adds replacement cards for some found in the base game, changing their costs or rewards, and adds several new cards to each phase, including an entirely new line of worker: the "New Farmer," which is costly, but also provides VPs during the Worker phase.

When playing with five players, the fifth player does not receive a start token for a new phase—instead, the holder of the fifth token receives two victory points (except on the first turn, when he or she instead receives two rubles) as compensation for not starting one of the four phases. This fifth token is only used in five-player games. Other than this—and advancing tokens two player positions each round—the game plays out exactly as before, with four phases per round: Worker, Building, Aristocrat, and Trading.

"The Banquet," designed by Karl-Heinz Schmiel, adds cards with special powers that allow players different types of actions on their turns.

The two expansions may be used separately or combined.

Expands:

Saint Petersburg
29549.name: Saint Petersburg: New Society & Banquet Expansion

29550.name: Picnic Treasure Hunt
29550.description: For 2 to 4 players Ages 6 - 12. Game comes with 24 destination cards, 4 player pawns, one die, and one spinner.

29551.name: G.I. Joe Card Game
29551.description: A card game for 2 to 6 players, in which the object is to get rid of your hand by playing one card per turn. The cards all portray different G.I. Joe characters, and are either numbered or marked with a star. Players try to match the current face up discard by either picture or number. Players who cannot play must draw from the discard pile. Play stops when one player is out of cards or when no one can play, and points are awarded based on remaining holdings.

29552.name: Bamsegrisen flyttar in
29552.description: This games purpose is to decorate a room. It is based on a memory concept.

29553.name: Scouting
29553.description:
Extrapolated from "Play the Game" by Brian Love;

One player plays a dispatch runner trying to break through a cordon of Boy Scout opponents. He begins at the top of the board and tries to get to the bottom. If he succeeds in avoiding being hemmed in by the enemy patrol the game is re-started by the dispatch runner setting off for home from the bottom of the board with the Scout Patrol once more trying to stop him. The game ends when either the Dispatch Runner has completed his double journey or when the scouts have captured him by hemming him in so he cannot move.

29554.name: Mount Everest
29554.description:
extrapolation from description in "Play the Game" by Brian Love;

Game for 2 to 6 players, divided into teams. Order of play is determined by a roll of the dice. Each team of two mountaineers move based on their choice of which mountaineer will use the die roll on each turn. Only one can move per turn. Different obstacles and hazards occur along the way making the climb difficult to finish. Both mountaineers must reach the summit by exact roll in order to win the race.

29555.description:
Miss Spider's Board Game is a simple matching game based on the characters from David Kirk's "Miss Spider" children's books.

The rules includes instructions for three different matching games. In all games, a set of 25 colored discs are placed on the board. The backs of the discs show either guests and items Miss Spider needs for her tea party, a picture of Miss Spider herself, simple instructions, or nothing at all. There are also four strips showing four guests or items needed for the party.

The first game is a cooperative matching game in which all players try to match all the items on all four strips.

The second game is a simple "concentration-style" memory game where players take turns trying to match a pair of pictures on the bottom of the disc.

In the third game, players each take one of the four strips and attempt to be the first to find all four items displayed on their strip.
29555.name: Miss Spider's Board Game

29556.name: Spider-Man 3 3D Skyscraper Game
29556.description:
Spider-Man 3 3D Skyscraper Game is a modular roll-and-move game given away in packs of Ovaltine 3-in-1 (a powdered chocolate flavoured malt drink). Each pack had 20 sachets and came with one module of the game. There are four different modules, each module consisting of a booklet of thick cardboard pages, which are to be cut up and assembled into skyscrapers and structures. The modules can be played individually or put together to form one big city - New York (structures include the Statue of Liberty and the Chrysler building).
The game is for two players, and one can choose to be either spidey or black spidey. The object of the game is to race around the city and the first player to reach the 'Winner' space wins. The path winds through the city and up and down the sides of the skyscrapers - the pieces can fit into slots in the walls. There are also spaces that allow a player to draw a card and follow instructions like, "Drink Ovaltine, get more power, Jump two steps forward", or, "Strong wind, all players go back four steps". A feature is that the die for the game is also included in each module - but you have to cut it out and assemble it yourself.
The text for the rules and on the cards are in Thai and English and the manufacturer of the drink is Thai. Besides Thailand, the packs were distributed in Singapore, Malaysia and Brunei.

29557.name: Radio Luxembourg Chartbusters Road Show
29557.description: This is an action game based around a board which can be played in teams. There is a tape of music and sometimes you have to dance to this. The idea is to win silver and gold and platinum discs - which you do by moving around the board and obeying instructions on cards.

29558.name: Politricks Louisiana Political Game
29558.description:
Discover Politricks, Louisiana's hottest new board game in which you could become governor with a roll of the dice! Continuous excitement and non-stop laughter await you and your friends as you "Campaign" your way through the ups and downs of the state's colorful political history. Gaining votes is easy, but so is losing them. So go ahead and take that bribe, just don't get caught! After all, Politricks is the name of the game!

Home Page: http://www.politricks.com/

29559.description:
Witches Cauldron—The Oosterbeek Perimeter is a historical module for ASL that allows you to recreate the classic struggle of the Battle of Arnhem at a house-by-house, 50 yards, scale.

Witches Cauldron—The Oosterbeek Perimeter puts the gamer literally inside the Hexenkessel, hammered by two Waffen SS panzer divisions day after day. There is no escape nor respite and this game is not suggested for the faint of heart. The games takes you back in time, to recreations of the very places in history where most of the Arnhem Victoria Crosses were earned in pitched combat, while staring down the dark menace of massive King Tigers, Sturmgeschutz, and a smörgåsbord of captured AFVs ranging from Dutch armored cars to French flame-throwing tanks.

Ownership of Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1 and West of Alamein: ASL Module 5 OR For King and Country: ASL module 5a are required to use this product.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
29559.name: Witches Cauldron: The Oosterbeek Perimeter – Arnhem 1944

32117.name: Total Axis Pack I: Eastern Front Firestorm

29560.description:
A 12 page historical background booklet, one page of Chapter H notes, 36 unmounted counters, including a Maj. Tapio, and 8 scenarios. Six of the scenarios are Finnish-Russian, one German-Russian, and one Finnish-German.

8 scenarios:
1) Toast Victory with Vodka: Petrozavodsk, Russia, 1 October 1941
2) At the Gates of Viipuri: Viipuri, Finland, 20 June 1944
3) Back to the V-T Line: Kuuterselka, Finland, 14 June 1944
4) The Gods of War: Kuuterselka, Finland, 13 June 1944
5) Forests of the North: 20 miles southwest of Louhki, Russia, 11 August 1941
6) Mannerheim's Cross: Karhumakea, Finland, 5 December 1941
7) Brothers in Arms: Tornio, Finland 5 October 1944
8) Artic Strongpoint: East of the Litsa River, Northern Finland, 1 February 1944
29560.name: Jatkosota: Finland's Continuation War for ASL

29561.description:
A Platoon Leader and ASL compatible module.

Ruweisat Ridge depicts the first battle of Alamein, July 1-15th 1942.

Ruweisat Ridge inclues a 28"x30" historical game map, six scenarios, a campaign game, and unmounted counters.
29561.name: Ruweisat Ridge: The First Battle of Alamein

29562.description:
Disguised as Spider-man, you try to be the first to climb to the top of the skyscraper. With a little luck and spider-sense, you can avid dangers and win the exciting race!

Contents:

39 window tile
1 finish tile
4 Spider-man card board playing pieces
1 counter




13 rows with 3 double sided tiles each - and a finish tile - form a skyscraper with 14 floors. You move your Spider-man onto a tile and turn it up side to reveal the action you have to perform - move up or down, miss a turn or jump over a floor.
The first player who reaches the 14th floor, wins.

For Ages 6 and up
29562.name: Spider-Man 3: The Ultimate Game

29563.description:
Distant Kingdoms is an expansion for the Federation Commander line of space combat games set in the Star Fleet Universe from Amarillo Design Bureau (ADB). This module focuses on the Hydrans, Lyrans, and WYNs.

Distant Kingdoms is accompanied by the now-standard array of boosters (additional ship cards) and squadron and border boxes (pewter miniatures).

To use Distant Kingdoms, a player needs at least one of the two base sets, Federation Commander: Klingon Border or Federation Commander: Romulan Border.

Home Page: http://www.federationcommander.com
29563.name: Federation Commander: Distant Kingdoms

29564.name: ¡Vaya cacao!
29564.description:
¡Vaya cacao! is a card game for 4 players that reproduces the work conditions in the cacao production cooperatives in Côte d'Ivoire.

Each player takes the role of a cooperative. The player's goal consists in sufficiently increasing the amount of cacao tons produced as well as raising the cacao's selling price to a number that makes a profit. The ultimate goal of the game is to get the 20 families who are part of the cooperative out of poverty.

To achieve this, the players need to earn a minimum of 42 million of CFA during the game.

29565.name: Dead & Alive
29565.description:
From the Designer of Maze of the Red Mage: A Solitaire Dungeon Adventure! and Tower of the Dread Mage:

Dead & Alive is a solitaire game of survival in a Zombie infested town. It is a stripped down travel version of a multi-player boardgame I created.

It all went wrong driving into town. A kid stepped out from between two parked cars. I tried to stop in time, but I couldn’t. I got out of the car and he was still moving. He was alive… but it was all wrong. His arms and legs were broken in impossible angles, but he was still alive and moving and… oh lord. I heard something and looked up, they were coming, all these shuffling people covered in blood and bite marks. Then the kid started squirming, teeth snapping… I just ran, ran for the nearest house to hide… the radio said some sort of virus had escaped, and the Coast Guard was ferrying people off the island. I heard a window smash below, I gotta find something to fight with. There are more of them moving towards this house now. If I can only get out of here alive…

In a town filled with zombies you move building to building looking for weapons to help you survive and maybe find another survivor to aid you...as well as roving packs of zombies looking to feed. The game is different every time you play and is only 2 pages. You will need the rules, 2d6 a piece of graph paper and a pencil to play.

You can download graph paper free if you look up my Tower of the Dread Mage Game!

Microbadges
Buy It

Buy It

29567.name: The Great Grape Ape Game
29567.description: Game based on Hanna-Barber television cartoon series which was a part of the 'Tom & Jerry Show'. The Great Grape Ape (40 feet tall and 2000 pounds) was about an ape and his talking dog Beegle Beagle as they drove around America looking for adventure. A spin and move game. The game included 4 markers, a spinner for movement and a background insert that gave the game a 3-d effect. Ages 7 - 12

29568.description:
Publisher's Description

Aw, shucks! Y'all loved Munchkin Cthulhu so much, we jes' had ta bring ya more of that down-home Munchkin craziness!

Munchkin Cthulhu 2 - Call of Cowthulhu puts the Great Old Ones out to pasture, Munchkin-style! In this 56-card supplement you'll find:


More monsters! Hog-Sothoth, the Sheep Ones, Shoggoats - even Cowthulhu itself!
More whackers! Squish unnatural creatures with the Rolling Pin, chop them down with the Scythe, or clean them up with the Super Duper Pooper Scooper.
A new card type - Madness! These are played like Curses, but every Madness has its advantages as well!


And more of everything else. Watch out for Old Man Nodens with his faithful Doggoth, resting on the porch. Defeat the Arkhamster with your Prize-Winning Preserves. And fear... Bovine Intervention!

Call of Cowthulhu. Country life will never be the same.


Other

Part of the Munchkin series

The Pegasus Spiele Edition "Munchkin Cthulhu 2 - Kuhthulhus Ruf" contains both Munchkin Cthulhu 2: Call of Cowthulhu and Munchkin Cthulhu 3: The Unspeakable Vault (in German).

French edition is "Munchkin Cthulhu 2 : De mal en pis !", by Edge
29568.name: Munchkin Cthulhu 2: Call of Cowthulhu

29569.name: Mosquito
29569.description:
From the box:

"Guide the spinning 'mosquito' through the hazards to score points. 'Sting' the hunter - TO MAKE HIS HAT FLY OFF."

Players manoeuver a spinning plastic top around a 13" x 15" three dimensional moulded plastic board. The board contains six numbered structures which must be negotiated in order. A seventh structure, the face of a moustached 19th century hunter has a tongue which, when activated by the top, causes his hat to pop off.

Players score ten points per structure successfully negotiated. Bonus points are awarded for correctly triggering the hunter's tongue.

29570.name: Spider's Maze
29570.description:
From the box:

"A surprise action game of balance.
weave through the web ... KNOCKOUT the SPIDER!"

Players attempt to cause a large black plastic spider to spring from the center of a plastic web-maze by guiding marbles along the strands of the web. The marbles trigger a rubber band which holds the spider in place.

29571.name: Racing Snakes
29571.description:
From the box:

"It's a simple game, just race across and back again.
Shake the dice and move your snake, but then some care you'll have to take.
Round the tree you'll have to go, see what colour you can throw."

Each player has a snake which consists of six plastic hexagons and a head piece. Players are also given a tree, the hexagonal base of which matches the color of the head of their particular snake. The trees serve as markers, defining start & finish points and course layout.

The plastic hexagons which form the 'body' of each snake come in six colors; these correspond to the colored dots on the sides of the die used for gameplay. Snakes move forward depending on the color thrown on the die; the color thrown becomes the TAIL of the snake and all hexagons situated behind this are moved to the front of the snake. The hexagonal segments must remain in the same sequence throughout the game.

The first player to complete whatever course was determined prior to the game starting is the winner (generally snakes start adjacent to their tree and return).

29572.name: Bucket of Fun
29572.description:
From the box:

"EXCITING ACTION - INDOORS OR OUT!
magic bucket pops out a shower of balls -
players scramble to retrieve them."

A plastic bucket about 8" high & 8" in diameter with a spring-loaded platform is filled with plastic colored balls. A knob is turned, releasing a timer which, in due course, activates the platform.

The plastic balls are propelled in all directions. Players attempt to be the first to retrieve all balls of their chosen color one-at-a-time and place them in their correspondingly colored plastic container tube.

Game gets very hectic.

29573.name: Winnie the Pooh Honey Tree Game
29573.description:
From the box:

"The bees have left the Honey Tree and are busy at work. Winnie-the-Pooh has climbed up the Tree and is filling himself with the honey that the busy bees have stored in their hive. His friends must save him by rushing to the Honey Tree to help him down before the bees return."

Players move along a modular cardboard path which is assembled prior to gameplay, towards a plastic three dimensional tree where Winnie The Pooh is stuck up a ladder. The path consists of colored squares; these colors correspond to cards which are drawn from a stack to determine the movement of each player.

Once a player reaches the tree they must drop a marble down a hole located in the top of the plastic structure; this may or may nor trigger the mechanism which causes Winnie to slide down the ladder, ending the game.

29574.description: Extrapolated from "Play the Game" by Brian Love; The game Russia versus Turkey is played by any even number of players who are either Russian or Turk. They sit in alternating seats around the board. Each player has a marker placed on the home port and two tokens placed in the pool. The Russian is the aggressor and moves first. Whoever starts rolls and then moves. Different squares have different instructions that must be followed when landed on. If you land on a space that an opponent is on you are repelled back to the space you started your move on and you lose your turn. Many spaces cause you to lose tokens to the pool, lose a turn, return to port etc. Victory is achieved by the side that has a majority of force in the enemies port at the end of the game.
29574.name: Russia versus Turkey

29575.name: Thief Of Bagdad
29575.description: Actually a spin and move game. Simple game from the 1940's. Game includes spinner with numbers 1 thru 6, 4 colored markers and 4 protection squares which could be used by your piece to avoid going to jail.

29576.description:
This is a kid's game designed for Ages 5 and up.

Brrr!!, is it cold around here! Now if I only could go into my igloo. However it must be built first. Let's look if we have everything we need: a color coded die, ice blocks... everything but snow! But the small polar bear can help you. Only the player that finishes his igloo in time will win here.
29576.name: Der kleine Eisbär und die Schnee-Iglus

29577.description:
This is a kid's game for Ages 4 and up.

What a mishap, the small polar bear brought the photos completely in disorder when looking at them with his best friends . With a good memory and some luck he succeeds to build the pictures up again. Of course the player with most photos will win.

Objective: score most winning points after all slides are used
- acting by turn -
active player uncovers one (of 36 in the beginning) slide:
if it shows a lemming, keep it and draw again;
if it is part of a bigger animal: uncover as many cards as points on your slide;
if you succeed forming a complete animal, keep it; if not:
flip these tiles over and place them back on the table.
Game ends after all slides are used.
29577.name: Kleiner Eisbär wo stecken wir?

29578.name: WYSIWYG
29578.description:
WYSIWYG (pronounced WIZ-ee-wig) is an acronym used in many computer applications that stands for "What you see is what you get". Since in this two player card game, the players get to see what cards they are playing for before they play to a trick, it's an appropriate title. WYSIWYG borrows some elements from a couple of old games called German Whist and Honeymoon Bridge, while adding in some new ideas of its own.

WYSIWYG is a trick taking card game for two players. After each player is dealt 13 cards, a hand proceeds in four separate phases. First, each player evaluates their hand and announces the total. Then, a bidding session takes place to establish the hand's trump suit and objective. Next, the players play to tricks, with the winner of each trick replacing their card with their choice of one of two exposed cards and the loser receiving the other card. Each trick is worth one mark. This continues until the deck is depleted. Finally, the players play out the remainder of their cards to tricks, each of which is worth two marks. If the player who set the trump suit has earned marks at least equal to a goal based upon the two hand evaluations and his bid, he wins the hand. Play continues until one of the players scores 50 points.

(description by Larry Levy)

29579.name: Chaos in Carpathia
29579.description: Gothic Horror miniature battles featuring struggles between men and monsters in the style of the films and fiction of old. Chaos In Carpathia is a skirmish miniature game designed for 28mm miniatures and perfect for use with the new line of miniatures by Blue Moon Manufacturing. Chaos In Carpathia will be 84 pages with color front and back covers and a black & white interior.

29580.name: Colour Shift
29580.description:
Colour Shift is an abstract strategy game for 1 to 6 players.

Players draw and place movement or special event cards in a race to collect the most scoring counters from a random tile board.

29581.description:
Recruit a Party. Kill the Monsters. Take Their Stuff!

Tomb pits opponents against one another in a game of monsters, traps, treasures, and spells. Attempts to capture the dungeon crawl experience without hours of preparation. Assemble a crack squad of adventurers and enter the fabled Goldenaxe Catacombs in search of glory and hidden treasure. With Tomb’s unique set-up and character recruitment, you’ll never play the same game twice.

Integrates with:

Tomb: Cryptmaster
INVALID OBJECT ID=67350, type=thing
29581.name: Tomb

29582.description:
Stoplights is a game for 2 or 3 players that is easy to learn, quick to play, and fun for all ages.

Players start with 4 cards each and compete to be the first to line up 5 of their color stoplights horizontally or diagonally.

On a players turn they may play a card and draw a replacement, cover any card on the table with one from their hand, or draw 2 cards. That's it! It sounds easy, but it is hard to do.

Games sometimes last only seconds, but most last several minutes. The strategies are deep, but the game is easy enough a 5 year old can win.

As an educational tool, Stoplights is a great way to help young ones count, and group colors.

Fans of strategy games will find it a quick, but challenging filler.

This game is suitable Ages 4 and up
29582.name: Stoplights

29583.name: Old Scratch
29583.description:
Old Scratch

"Tommorows safety thru todays fun". 1959 board game by Decor Note Co. of St. Paul Minnesota, Educational Games Division #200. The box comes with 2 Driver training games in the same box. Let's Drive and Old Scratch (see separate entry for Let's Drive). This colorful 2 sided game board measures 20 1/2" x 15 3/4" The instructions are on each side of the gameboard for that particular game. There are 15 white cards and 11 yellow cards, each side of a card is for one of the games. The game includes tiny plastic model cars. Object of the game is to successfully complete the course. Old Scratch is described as a game of chance. Rolling particular combinations of numbers with the dice results in benefits to the "drivers"

29584.name: Let's Drive
29584.description: "Tommorows safety thru todays fun". 1959 board game by Decor Note Co. of St. Paul Minnesota, Educational Games Division #200. The box comes with 2 Driver training games in the same box. Let's Drive and Old Scratch (see separate entry for Old Scratch). This colorful 2 sided game board measures 20 1/2" x 15 3/4" The instructions are on each side of the gameboard for that particular game. There are 15 white cards and 11 yellow cards, each side of a card is for one of the games. The game includes tiny plastic model cars. Object of the game is to successfully complete the course.

29585.name: Voetballuh
29585.description:
‘Voetballuh’ is a Dutch soccer game with the same graphics as the comic book series of FC Knudde by Toon Van Driel.
The players decide who’s the best team in ‘the Derby of the Low Countries’, Holland and Belgium. Gameplay is straightforward: You take a spin on the spinning wheel, move your player on the path to the other goal. When a player arrives in the box, a chance is given to score. First player to reach 10 points is the winner.

29586.name: You Run The Zoo!
29586.description:
Imagine yourself in charge of a zoo! What animals would you select? Would you focus on building a zoo that your visitors enjoyed the most, or would you prefer running the biggest zoo with all the large animal enclosures? In "You Run the Zoo!" you will be competing with other zoos to create the most magnificent zoo using limited resources within a fixed amount of time.

"You Run the Zoo!" is a fast-playing game, where limited options create challenging decisions, making every move an important one. A zoo has 16 available enclosures. You will fill them in with animals of your choice, gaining points along the way for the rarity of the animal, and gaining secret points for "visitor cards" requiring certain animals or arrangements at your zoo.

29587.name: Kanzlerwahl
29587.description:
"Kanzlerwahl" is completely described in the small magazine "Wahlspiele", a special edition of the "Pöppel Revue" published on the occasion of the SPIEL 1995 in Essen.
"Kanzlerwahl" means election of the chancellor. All players start with multi-functional cards and some money. The game is played in several rounds. First 3 candidates will be determined by the possession of specific cards. All players will have 5 minutes for negotiating and trading. Then all candidates will held a speech and announce their political program. They are allowed to lie. All players vote with their cards. The candidate with the absolute majority will be chancellor. If there is no absolute majority, there will be an additional election between the favorites. The chancellor receives his salary and announces his future politics. All players with adequate cards will receive a corresponding income. The game ends after several rounds when a player has reached a specific amount of money.

29588.name: Watergate Impeachment
29588.description: Another of the many games created regarding Richard Nixon and the Watergate Scandal. This game advertised itself as "two games for the price of one" and "twice the fun, half the price"

29589.name: Battle of Britain
29589.description:
The Battle of Britain was the German attempt to gain air supremacy before launching their planned invasion of Britain - "OPERATION SEA LION".

In Call Sign 7's Battle of Britain game you can play as either side in this crucial conflict, and see how things may have gone differently if you had been there. Commanding your aircraft on the unique multi-tiered combat arena you can choose to:-

Represent England
Will you defend your country at all costs during this desperate time? Succeed and you will deliver Hitler his first major defeat, paving the way to the D-Day invasion and the destruction of the Thousand Year Reich.

Represent Germany
Follow the orders issued by Reichmarshall Hermann Goering on the 30th of June 1940 and destroy the Royal Air Force! After all, the odds are in your favour 3 to 1. Can you change history and do your countrymen proud? Clear the skies of the British pest and open the door for the coming invasion. Word has it, this time next year you'll be holidaying on the very ground you fought over (with the added bonus of promotion).

29590.name: Meet the Prophets
29590.description:
How well do you know your LDS prophets?

This game includes four sets of rules for play. All of them center around matching and knowing the order of the LDS prophets. The cards include facts about the prophets, pictures, order of succession and signatures.

Note: This 1982 version only covers the prophets through Spencer W. Kimball.

29591.name: Whirlpool
29591.description: Extrapolated from "Play the Game" by Brian Love. This is a 2 to 4 player game that is won by throwing low numbers on the dice instead of high numbers. The vortex of the game is a continuation of spaces on a board that slowly progresses from the outside edge to the center. Once you have reached the center spot your piece is out of the game, so the object is to be the last player with an active piece on the board. If you land on a space with another player you change places with that player. When getting close to the center of the board landing on a circle of your color carries you into the vortex and your piece is lost. If you land on a space of your color called a refuge space your piece is sheltered there until you roll a 6. If you land a someone else's refuge place you lose a turn unless you are displaced by the correct owner of that space, in which case you are sent to the vortex. The winner is the last player left with a piece on the board.

29592.name: Coast to Coast
29592.description: This is what the box called a Radar Action Game. The object of the game is to drive your Motorcycle cross-country by Remote Control and was made by the Ewing Mfg and Sales Co of Pasadena, California. The game has a board and a working remote control with steering stick, a set of instructions, a Coast to Coast Finish line, 4 motorcycles and 8 plastic tunnels.

29593.name: Doghouse Game
29593.description: From Kenworthy Educational out of Buffalo New York. Box claims that this is an interesting course in Phonics taught as a game and that it is equally effective when used singularly and in groups.

29594.name: Score-A-Word
29594.description:
Score a Word -- The Crossword Game Craze

This game is remarkably similar to Scrabble. Players have racks of letter tiles which they use to build words, crossword style on a board. The letters have point values according to their frequency in the language.
The Board does not have the Bonus spaces as the Scrabble board does, however. Instead, every space has two Premium letters written in the corner. Players able to play a matching letter on premium space during to course of play scores double or triple for that letter. Players successfully placing two or more premium letters in a word score double or triple for the word.

29595.description:
The war has grown bitter. As the 3 mage sects battle over the control of Mana, the Flux has been thrown into chaos. From the Flux come the Creationists, a tribe of creatures dedicated to the health and well being of the Flux. These creatures come to put an end to the war, and restore balance once and for all.

Their coming did not go as planned. The Creationists have now been thrown into the middle of the bloody war and are barely holding their own against the other sects. To make matters worse, a small group of twisted Purists have been performing strange and sick experiments on fallen Creationists. These so called “Elitists” have taken the love of their elemental magic to the extreme using what they now know of the Creationists power.

With 5 groups now vying for power, what will become of the Flux? The only way to find out is to pit yourself in the middle of the war and see where fate takes you.

Creationists and Elitists is a free expansion for Elementalis. This expansion allows the game to handle up to 5 players with two new Mage types to diversify game play.
29595.name: Elementalis: Creationists and Elitists

29596.name: Little Black Sambo
29596.description:
Understanding and appologizing that this is a very politically incorrect game for this day and age. I have included this game (dated from 1924) for completeness. The games information comes from the AGPC Archives of Games.

" Happy Children are found whenever they are grouped around the new board game of LITTLE BLACK SAMBO. If the eager child listens in open-mouthed wonder to the story of how Little Black Sambo met all those 4 tigers in the jungle, gave up and then won back from them his little red coat, the pair of beautiful blue trousers, the green umbrella and the purple shoes with crimson linings what do you think he will do when given a handsome game board on which he and his little friends play out the story. There is Little Black Sambo himself, he is pursued by the 4 great tigers with the clothes as forfeits, when he is overtaken and of course returns home at the end. The game board is handsomely lithographed in colors. There is a separate carton which contains the substantial spinner and the men." Each game comes in a separate wrapper and is attractively labeled and sells for $1.00 per game. Saafield Publishing Company, Akron, Ohio.

29597.name: Smokey Bear Game
29597.description:
Milton Bradley issued this very simple roll and move advertising game to go along with the country's Smokey Bear "Only you can prevent forest fires!" campaign.

The colorful board has a forest with Smokey and lots of woodland animals. The object is to be the first to travel through the forest and reach the "finish" spot first. Along the way are several yellow circles where you help Smokey put out a campfire, pick up a candy wrapper and so on. There are 4 pawns and a spinner attached to the inside cardboard instructions.

29598.name: Big Ten Football Game
29598.description:
Rules for this game were extrapolated from the AGPC Online rules archives;

Big Ten Football

Dice driven football game from the late 1920's produced by the Sanwah Keen Game Co., 625 East Market Street, Stockton, California.

Game is played over a 20 minute time-frame divided into 10 minute halves. Game has board with results listed depending on if a pass or run is called by the Offensive player. Different codes show Penalties, Fumbles, Interceptions etc.

One unusual feature of the game is a connotation at the bottom of the rule book which states that; "The Big Ten game board provides an excellent medium for following football games as they are broadcasted play by play over the radio. When used for this purpose the dice are of course discarded. By following the broadcasted game in this manner an accurate picture of every situation is presented to the audience at all times."

29599.name: Scandaroon
29599.description:
Scandaroon is an engaging and quizzical card game for 3 or 4 players played over four rounds. Players are dealt a hand of cards each round, with which they will compete to create their own high scoring row, while seeking to minimize their opponents’ scores.

Players are awarded victory points for specific achievements during the game, such as getting the highest score in a single round, and victory points may change as the game develops.

Scandaroon has a scoreboard, a set of wooden markers for each player and a pack of special cards, each of which has a scoring value, a suit, and an effect or ability that will modify the scoring values of other cards.

"Scimitar Lusts To Take A Life Away
Subtle Strength Is Gained 'Neath Crescent Moon
Courtly Intrigues Follow Turbans' Play
Cross-Tiles Their Gifts Bestows In Scandaroon"
(extract from 'The Rubiyat of Th’ Noble Lady yon')

29600.name: Miss America Pageant Game
29600.description: This 1988 Miss America Game is a trivia game about the life and occurences of things during the pageant.

29601.name: Metagon
29601.description:
From the description on the back of the box:

Metagon is a game of skill in which chance plays a small part. It can be played by two, four or six players either singly, in pairs or teams of three. The components of the game are 36 different octagonal tiles or metagons and a playing board.

The object of Metagon is to gain tiles from the playing ground. This can be achieved in either of two ways.

1. The simplest way of winning tiles is to create a straight line with three adjacent tiles having the same coloured motifs in the same relative position on each tile. Lines may be horizontal, vertical or diagonal. When a player has formed a straight line, he removes the two tiles placed earlier in the line and places these in a separate 'scoring stack', face up.

2. The second way of gaining tiles is to form a parallelogram by aligning the same coloured motifs on four tiles in the same relative position on each tile. Parallelograms may be any size and aligned horizontally, vertically or diagonally. When a player has placed a parallelogram he removes the three tiles placed earlier and adds these to his scoring stack.

The game ends when players have placed all their playing stack tiles on the board. The player with the most tiles in his scoring stack is the winner.

29602.description:
Okko is a miniature game that is played on a board with squares. It simulates skirmishes between Samurai and other typical Japanese-inspired characters (Ninjas, Geishas !!!) in the empire of Pajan. Each player controls from 4 to 6 characters

Okko is released as basis boxes containing the rules, adventure book, 6 double sided modular game boards, 10 special dice and 20 cardboard miniatures.

There are pewter miniatures (unpainted) to replace the cardboard minis included in this game.

Okko is inspired from a comic published by "Les Editions Delcourt" (French), "Archaia Studios Press" (English) and "Silvester Strips" (Dutch), "Carlsen Comics" (German)
29602.name: Okko: Era of the Asagiri

boardgamehonor.21208: 2009 Charles S. Roberts Best World War 2 Era Board Wargame Nominee

29603.description:
Solitaire study of America's most bloody and heroic day in WWII. The player controls the US forces landing along the five mile stretch of Omaha Beach on D-Day and their desperate struggle to establish a viable beachhead. The game covers the entire first day at a time scale that varies from 15 minutes per turn (during the initial landings) to 30 minutes per turn later in the day. Units are companies and include assaulting infantry, engineers and amphibious tanks. The game system controls the hidden German defenders in their "Widerstandsnest" resistance points, revealing the defenders and their reserves as the American survivors of the first landing waves make their way up the bluffs. Rules cover amphibious landings, German fields of fire, artillery, tidal movement, and intangibles such as US leadership under fire and the initiative of the American GI. One map, two counter sheets, 55 cards.

Additional Notes:

=====

352 counters. Basic unit size is the US infantry company. German units consist of Widerstandsnest crews and reinforcement infantry companies. US tanks, and some US artillery, AA and anti-tank units are also included. US engineers are represented abstractly, clearing beach obstacles early in the game and opening traffic routes off the beach later in the game.

The 34" x 22" map depicts the entire Omaha invasion area 9km long, going inland 4km, at 250 meters per hex. Hexes are oversized (almost 1") so that symbology facilitating German placement, fire and actions can be seen without having to pick up units.

Time scale is 15 minutes per turn from 0600 hours to 1000 hours, shifting to 1/2 hour turns from 1000 to 1800 hours.

A deck of 55 cards performs triple duty -- determining results of US amphibious landings, determining an event each turn, and determining which German units fire or perform other actions each turn.

The game's solitaire system is based on that used previously in Operation Jubilee: Dieppe, August 1942.


=================

Decision Games Omaha Beach official url: http://shop.decisiongames.com/ProductDetails.asp?ProductCode...
29603.name: D-Day at Omaha Beach

29604.name: Red Riding Hood
29604.description: Game box describes the game as a wonderful game to delight youngsters. Simple children's game where you spin a spinner and then move along a path. At different spots on the path there are squares that require you to pick up a card. Those cards either help or hurt you in your attempt to move through the board. The game features a magic remote control magnetic wolf that moves around the board attempting to impede your progress.

29605.name: Funnel Web: The Deadly Game of Escape
29605.description: Try to escape the deadly clutches of the funnel web spider. Pit your d12 rolling skills against its sticky web. Includes "fascinating facts" on Australian animals like the kangaroo, koala and funnel web spider. Game comes with 4 variations.

29606.name: Operation Walküre
29606.description:
Operation Walküre is a mini solitaire game about the 1944 plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler. The goal of the conspirators was to kill Hitler in his East Prussian headquarters, the 'Die Wolfsschanze' (the Wolf’s lair) and then seize power in Germany.

The game recreates the difficulties in getting close to Hitler while avoiding Hitler’s suspicions and being arrested by the Gestapo.

29607.name: Hack-away
29607.description:
Hack-away is a roll and move game based on taking a pony on a hack through the country, with players sometimes having to answer questions about horses and horsemanship to avoid missing a turn or being sent back down the track.

There are shortcut bridleways that can be used, but these are riskier routes and may mean the player goes back to the start.

Although the game only comes with 4 pawns, there's no reason to stop 5 or more people playing the game, if you have different tokens for each player.

29608.name: Ki Shogi
29608.description:
A modern variation of the traditional Japanese form of chess played on an infinite "board" with cubical pieces.

Pieces are introduced to the field adjacent to their King and must remain so lest they become "stranded" and thus lost. A piece promotes every time it moves or captures, flipping to the opposite face or to the next most powerful form, respectively.

The objective, as in most forms of chess, is to checkmate the opponent's king.

29609.name: London Murder Mystery Game
29609.description:
The London Murder Mystery game has unique gameplay in that the evidence necessary to solve the crime is buried in 'dossiers'. Each player receives a dossier. A police inspector's report is also included with variable evidence. This is probably the game's most notable mechanic - unlike most of this genre and vintage, this game has strong replayability.

Certainly dated, a flexible vinyl phonograph record sets the scene. Once the evidence has been presented, players make an accusation, based on establishing motive and opportunity. A red plastic 'magnifying glass' is used to check the answer based on the evidence.

29611.name: The Twelve
29611.description:
The Twelve
2-6 Players

Who knows the twelve members of the European Economic Community? Who recognizes their flags? Here is a game which helps us to learn both.

Contents
48 Cards

Object of the Game
To make as many flags as possible

Players take turns in turning over cards to collect four cards that make up a flag of an EEC member state

29612.name: Kurt Olsson: Spelet om mig själv
29612.description: Ever wanted to be a talk show host, just like Kurt Olssson? Here's your chance! Move around the board, make interviews with your fellow players, play silly games, demonstrate how to make thing out of milk cartons, guess the validity of incredible statements and much more. The first player to reach 60 minutes of air time wins!

29613.description: Can you stack six dice on top of each other within thirty seconds? Who can be the first person to roll a triple? Can you name as many state capitals as your roll? Know what arachibutyrophobia is? Arachibutyrophobia??? DICEcapades – which includes a mixture of dice games, physical challenges, artistic creations, and trivia questions – doesn't involve just the luck of the dice, but also the smarts of the roller!
29613.name: DICEcapades

29615.name: Body Talk
29615.description:
Body Talk is a charades game. A phrase to be guessed is drawn from one of over 700 difficulty rated cards. One player attempts to describe this phrase by pointing to icons on a board. The main twist here, and the reason the game is called Body Talk, is that both the game board with the icons and the pointer used are worn by the players. The gameboard is in the form of an icon-covered apron and the pointer is a bib with a pipe-cleaner protruding from it.

Small plastic clothespins indicate the scores or positions of the players and also indicate by color the difficulty rating of the phrase to be guessed.

29616.name: Nuit Blanche
29616.description:
Nuit Blanche is a simulation of the French national sport called Boule. Many active French players call it also Pétanque.
The aim of the game is to get your quite heavy metal balls as close to the smaller, wooden and colored 'jack'. The winner is the player whose ball is closest to the jack. The Team achieving first 13 points wins the match.

In this boardgame adaption you roll out the flexible map and soon opposing and own balls group themselves around the goal ball "jack" and the players stand before the decision, depending upon game situation, whether to aim or to shoot.

To determine if your action was successful or not you will use a two-pieced plastic ball with a pointer and two scales. In a dexterity depending action you shake that ball trying to get that pointer pointing at the right position. At first you won't succeed very well but with more experience you will find that this process is not only luck but also controllable.

29617.name: Ten Pins
29617.description: Table top bowling game. Game comes with 10 wooden pins that measure approximately 4 1/2" tall & 3 wooden balls. The pins are vividly colored. Object of course is to knock down the most pins.

29618.name: Tally Hi
29618.description: Object of this game is to reach a target sum exactly or to force an opponent over. Two dice are rolled and then 20 is added to that sum. That total becomes the target score. The game has a sheet with numbers on them. (1,2,3,4 repeated 4 times) Object is, on your turn to cover a number in an attempt to reach the Target score exactly. Players alternate covering numbers until either you cover a number that exactly hits the target score or you cover a number that forces your opponent go over the total because all he has left are number higher than what is needed. He then is forced to go over and you win.

29619.name: The Child Awareness Game
29619.description: This game was endorsed by the Adam Walsh Child Resource Center and is of course the product of the abduction and killing of Adam Walsh in 1981. His father John's successful television show "America's Most Wanted" has successfully caught criminals since. This game tries to teach children how to avoid and what to do when faced with danger.

29620.description: Simple Spin and Move game from the Beetle Bailey Cartoon Strip. Featuring Beetle and the Sarge and Killer and Zero. Different spaces on the board either help or hinder your progress.
29620.name: Beetle Bailey's Hilarious New Army Game

29621.name: House of Whack
29621.description:
From the publisher's description:

"...you are ready to visit the wondrous House of Whack, the legendary extra dimensional mansion full of bizarre rooms, fiendish minions and outrageous artifacts.

The House looks different each time you play because the board unfolds as you open doors to reveal new rooms. Will you grab a snack from the Vending Machines or find yourself in the middle of the Minefield? Each room affects the way you play the game, presenting new strategies and dangers. And that’s not even taking into account the Whack Deck, which is full of entertaining wonders. Face the House’s wicked minions and traps, recruit allies to aid you, and discover violent and valuable props to add to the blender of mayhem that awaits you inside this game.

Whether you enjoy playing via cleverness, deceit, brute force, or cooperation, House of Whack has something to offer everyone!"

Home Page: http://www.houseofwhack.net

29622.name: Sentence Zone
29622.description:
From publisher's website:

If you're looking for a fun way to improve writing and grammar skills, this game is for you! For 2 to 6 players, grades 1st and up. Rules are easily mastered. The Sentence Zone can be played at six levels - from Level 1 in which the player builds a subject and verb sentence, to Level 6 in which the player builds complex sentences with independent and dependent clauses. With over 500 color coded cards, students are sure to be unique and entertaining every time. A great reinforcing individual activity where a player keeps track of his score from day to day, trying to top his previous score, or a great group activity where competition drives creativity and learning. An instructive and enjoyable way to shatter the tedium of English grammar lessons!

29623.name: Puttentaken
29623.description:
From the publisher's website:

Be the only player left with chips to win this fun and frantic dice game. Roll the dice to determine if you will "Put" or "Take" chips from the pot.

The yellow die can change everything as it lets you steal chips from your opponents. And, when you do, everything changes!

29624.name: Skribble Dash
29624.description:
From the publisher's website:

Can you draw an egg? How about the sun? Then YOU can play Skribble Dash!™

Roll the die to choose the category. The harder the clue the more points you and the guesser will earn.

This crazy fun doodling game will keep EVERYONE on their toes as EVERYONE tries to guess what the player is drawing!

29625.name: 59 Seconds
29625.description:
From the publisher's website:

So you think you're good, huh? Well, try this for size: you need to beat your opponent by getting rid of all your cards AND get the job done in 59 seconds! If either of you can't win before time runs out, you need to start the round over! The first one to win 5 rounds is the winner!

59 Seconds™ isn't called the world's fastest card game for nothing - you'll need skill, speed, and lightning fast reflexes to master this game!

29626.description:
Each player has its own robot production company. In order to build robots in time, players have to acquire, trade and build robot parts. Players sabotage each others production line which can lead to total destruction of an almost finished robot. Some construction parts are illegal and if the inspectors come to your factory they can confiscate your illegal parts.

Robotics is a crazy construction and trading game for 3-4 players in a not too distant future.
29626.name: Robotics

29627.description:
In 1410 Polish king Jagiełło fought the battle for supremacy over southern Baltic regions with Teutonic Knights order which called knights from all Europe for help. On 15th July over 30,000 of knights of both sides fought for supremacy and fame. The battle was complete victory of Polish forces and begun descend of power of Teutonic Order.

Game allows to fight on both side and use tremendous numbers of knight to repeat (or reverse) the result of the historical battle. Besides historical there is also scenario which allows to verify what would have happened if Teutonic Order didn't wait and attacked early on Polish army arriving on the battlefield.

Second edition of the game under new medieval system rules.
29627.name: Grunwald 1410 (second edition)

29628.name: Vertical Gaming System
29628.description:
JDB Games' Vertical Gaming System are a series of 3D Tic-Tac-Toe games that help prepare students to understand and enjoy the fantastic Time Vectors.

3x3x3 Tic Tac Toe: Play until a student can always win if (s)he goes first.
4x4x4 Tic Tac Toe: Like Qubic, the first player can always win, but the solution isn't readily apparent.
5x5x5 Tic Tac Toe: An even further expansion, it's also possible to play for four-in-a row on this matrix.

Remember, these systems are stepping stones to Time Vectors--a wonderful, educational game for improving visual-spatial awareness.

29629.name: Carrefours
29629.description: The board represents a track that can be followed with a car (the pawns represent cars). Each player receivers his car and 250.000 francs at the start of the game. In each round the players roll the dice and advance their car. During the game the players can enter in sports events (they pass them on their track and they include a ski event, horseback riding, tennis, sailing or golf). These events cost 50.000 francs to enter but can earn the player points. The players can also encounter bad luck during their journey (flat tire, accident, they can even end up in hospital). In the end the player who completes the track first with the most points wins the game. This game was created in 1955 by the same designer as 1000 Bornes.

29630.name: Surfer's Life
29630.description: The goal of this windsurfing game is to surf faster a row of regatta's than your competitor on some of the most beautiful beaches around the world. The conditions to participate in certain regattas depends on the skills and the surfboards that a player has obtained. The surfboards can be obtained in auctions and they can be exchanged as well. He handles this part of the game the best has certainly got an advantage to win Surfer's Life.

29631.name: Footgoal
29631.description: The players try to make a path with cards that are marked with lines. The lines should connect to the goal of the opponents. The players can also try to interrupt the paths of their opponents.

29632.name: Calculus
29632.description: Learn the term dividing whilst playing. Every player starts with a math task, the result determines which track has to be followed on the board. Three degrees of difficulty allow younger and older children to play this game.

29633.name: Tom & Lucy
29633.description: A passionate game full of vital information. For adults and young people Ages 12 and up. How can we arm ourselves against AIDS ? Do mosquitoes transmit AIDS ? What is the immune system, the blind period ? Why is vaccine research so difficult ? You can find the answers to these and to many other questions in Tom & Lucy, the great educational game about AIDS. The objective : to be first to eliminate AIDS from 2 zones in the world.

29634.name: Lucky Sixes
29634.description:
The Felix Sex (Lucky Sixes) was a popular game played in the Roman Empire. Numerous boards, dices and pieces have been found and there are even some descriptions of the game in Latin documents. The Felix Sex appears to be the same as the Duodecima Scripta (The game of Twelve Points), probably the ancestor of the Backgammon and certainly very similar to the Ancient Greek board games.
The oldest boards have three rows of twelve playing squares, divided down the middle by a gap. Usually Romans had a fondness to divide the boards with letters instead of squares, with popular content and sometimes with rude comments.

29635.name: The Dinosaur Card Game
29635.description:
From the back of the box:

"Eight different games to play!

Digging Up Dinosaurs - a quick-reflex matching game
Dinosaur Dup - you'll need good observation skills to win
Double Dinosaur - if you're lucky, you'll collect the most pairs
Dinosaur Snap - a race to win all the cards
Dinosaur Match-Up - a cooperative matching game
Dinosaur Rummy - the beginner's version
Advanced Dinosaur Rummy - Mom & Dad will like this one, too!
Fishin' for Dinos - everyone's favorite!
