While enjoying many different games, dinosaur fans and their families can identify the 10 popular dinosaurs illustrated on the cards."

29636.name: Lexogon One
29636.description:
From publisher's website:

Lexogon One is the same, addicting, word-finding game as Lexogon™, but designed especially for the vocabulary and spelling levels expected of middle-schoolers. As with Lexogon, everyone plays all the time. It’s great for intergenerational play, it’s an exciting game for family night play (or for occasions when players want an easier challenge than Lexogon). And teachers see Lexogon One as a great addition for their spelling and vocabulary sections. Kids give it a great learning testimonial. A typical comment from a fourth grader – “I can’t believe I’m learning something and having fun at the same time."

boardgamehonor.12429: 2007 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "6 years and up" Nominee

29637.description: Colored magnets are placed on the drawing board. Hints are given, where to draw lines. The children then have to guess the image.
29637.name: Gesagt - getan!

boardgamehonor.12429: 2007 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "6 years and up" Nominee

29638.description: Jump contest at the frog lake! Can you jump far enough to reach the lake? But you only get points if you can place three frogs in a row.
29638.name: Hop Hop Hooray!

29639.description:
Roll the colored dice and move the little mouse over the board. Colored cars give you things to do: imitate animals, dance in a circle, make funny faces. For doing that, you get a new piece to build a tent for the mouse. Everybody plays together.

The game is for the very young (20 months up) and develops social skills, rhythm, language, motor function and playing with rules.
29639.name: Mein erstes Mitmach-Spiel

29640.name: Tornerspelet
29640.description: Swedish game based on real medieval personalities. You go to a tournament and have to get a horse, armor, weapon and a squire. When you have that you can compete in four different tournament disciplines. When one player is the champion in all disciplines he wins the game.

29641.description:
A house with 12 flats. Each flat contains a stack of images. The top image shows who lives here. Then the doors are closed. The dice decides where you can ring. But you can only open the door, after guessing who is living there. If you are right you get the image card.

Nicely made memo game.
29641.name: Ding Dong

29642.description: The players look at several images (holiday pictures) and try to find out who has the most cars, animals, trees, etc. in their pictures.
29642.name: Was zählt?

29643.name: Whist-O
29643.description:
This Bingo variant incorporates elements of the card game Whist. At the start of the game, a standard playing card deck is dealt out evenly into stacks in front of all of the players. Each player is given a board showing all of the values in all of the suits. Every turn, starting with the dealer, players ante into the pot and turn up the top cards of their stacks. The player with the highest-ranked card wins the trick and gets to put a chip on their board in the corresponding space. Losers all have to put chips into the pot. The first player to get five consecutive values in a single suit (a vertical row) or four suits in a single value (a horizontal row) calls Whist-O and wins the pot.

The game includes 12 boards and a bag of red plastic chips, but playing cards are not provided.

29644.name: More Campaigns and Battles from the Age of Reason: Volume II

10310.name: Warfare in the Age of Reason

29644.description:
Eighty-page follow-on scenario booklet for Warfare in the Age of Reason (required for use).

Contents:

Brunswick's War-A two or more player campaign game of the struggle for western Germany in 1759.

Warfare at Sea in the Age of Reason-complete rules for the Age of Sail, It can be used to right historical naval battles of with The Sport of Kings to enrich the campaign experience. The rules have simple mechanics, but create a real feel of naval warfare for the times of de Ruyter to Nelson (1650-1815).

The Age of Marlborough-An extensive and detailed set of army lists for the Marlburian and Great Northern Wars, with optional rules to add period feel to the original Age of Reason rules.

Nine historical scenarios for Age of Reason-three from the War of Austrian Succession in Italy, five from the Seven Years War in western Germany, and one from the American Revolution.

Also includes errata and Q&A for 2nd edition Warfare in the Age of Reason.

Expands:

Warfare in the Age of Reason

29645.name: HI-RO
29645.description:
extrapolated From Games Archives rules for the game; HI-RO is a fast and exciting game. Any number of players may play by having a tray of blocks (dice). The object of the game is to turn your blocks until all 5 of them have the same number appearing along the row of sides facing you. The first person to accomplish this calls out "Hi RO" and receives a score determined by the size of the numbers that he/she lines up.

The 5 blocks are set up to that all blanks appear at the top then the tray is passed around the table. The first player moves the center block 3 spaces. That in turn will reveal a number on the top block. That number determines the number of spaces that the next player must turn and so on. Each player must turn the center block with his first play. After that he may move any of his blocks in an attempt to line up 5 faces numbered alike. The top side of each block last turned controls the move of the next player but you try to score the sides facing you.

29646.name: Battle of the Sexes Card Game: IQ Test
29646.description:
Forget about measuring your IQ with a traditional test - get your brain working overtime with the Battle IQ Test that requires superior gender and mind-bending abilities!

The winner is the first team to win 3 cards.
50 cards with 144 Questions

29647.name: Battle of the Sexes Card Game: Blind Date
29647.description:
Battle of the Sexes Blind Date is about defending your gender and finding out once and for all which sex really knows more about the dating game - Male or Female?

This card game tests one's knowledge of the opposite sex with a series of gender-based questions or challenges on dating, love, friendship and relationships.

29648.description: From the rules: "Chevauchee (translated: 'War Ride') is a simple card-based medieval battle game for 2 players. Players draw cards from several decks to form a Base Force made up of Household units, Commanders, Tactics Cards, Mercenaries, Levies, and Weapons and Equipment. Players can then allocate funds from the war chest to get additional Mercenaries, Levy, or Weapons and Equipment to customize their armies further. Players then proceed to deploy for two combats, the Van, which is an abbreviated engagement, and the Main, which is the heart of the game. Victory goes to the side that sweeps the battlefield of all opposing units by the end of any Main Combat Round (not Van)."
29648.name: Chevauchee

29649.description: Spin and move game where Barney is trying to get Sparkplug (his horse) to his Reward of a bail of hay without Sparky winding up in the Glue Factory.
29649.name: Barney Google and Spark Plug Game

29650.name: Reg'lar Fellers Card Game
29650.description: From Kidd's: Card Game based on the Gene Byrnes Famous Cartoon from the mid 1920's. Also known as the "Peppy Game"

29651.name: Bop Hockey
29651.description:
Advertised as a 'Family fun Game" for Ages 3 and up.

Game box advertises that the game comes with a super speed roller puck, carom boards and a slick durable playing board.

Hockey for two. Hit the puck into the other person's goal. A blocker is located in front of each goal to act as a helper "goalie".

boardgamecompilation.40822: Zooloretto: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #1

29652.description:
This expansion was sent to people who entered an Abacus contest in May 2007. It is a postcard that contains three new development boards, rules, and instructions for cutting apart the pieces. The boards contain these animals: panda, chimpanzee, and camel.

These 3 development boards are laid out in the center of the game. Each board can hold 2 tiles of the animal indicated. Using a Money Action, a player can buy one of these boards from the center for 2 coins.
29652.name: Zooloretto: Three Extra Enclosures

29653.description:
Players spin the spinner and move their caterpillar box around the board, adding food pieces to their box. At various points, players must collect enough food to proceed. First player around the board wins.

This is a different game from the same-named Very Hungry Caterpillar Game, which is made further confusing because both games have very similar box-fronts, using the same picture from the cover of the book. This game requires players to move around a board and collect food, meeting certain goals along the way.
29653.name: The Very Hungry Caterpillar Game

29654.description:
The first expansion to the revolutionary Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game is Stonehenge: Nocturne. This expansion continues the tradition of bringing the best board game designers in the world together to work on different games using the same pieces.

Stonehenge: Nocturne features three wildly different games by four world-class designers. This expansion's designers are Klaus-Jürgen Wrede (designer of Carcassonne), Andrew Looney (designer of Fluxx), and the team of Bruno Cathala and Serge Laget (designers of Shadows Over Camelot). Plus there's a bonus solitaire game by Mike Selinker. The games uniquely showcase the personalities of their designers, giving players a wide variety of play experiences.

Nocturne also expands Stonehenge by introducing pieces for sixth and seventh players. Previously published games can also be played with these extra pieces.

Stonehenge: Nocturne contains 20 disks, 20 bars, and two pawns in two new colors, and one rule book with these brand-new games:


Sun & Moon (2, 4, or 6 players) by Klaus-Jürgen Wrede
The Star Gate (2-7 players) by Bruno Cathala and Serge Laget
Stonehenge Hippie Festival (3-6 players) by Andrew Looney
Battle of the Beanfield (1 player) by Mike Selinker


Expands

Stonehenge: An Anthology Board Game
29654.name: Stonehenge: Nocturne Expansion

29655.name: Grave Digger
29655.description:
Description from designer's website:

There's a vampire hiding in the cemetery, and the town council has offered a large reward to the first grave digger who can find the creature and destroy it. The tools you'll need are scattered around the cemetery grounds, but the vampire has summoned several phantoms to break those tools before you can use them. You also might dig up the wrong grave and miss your chance to destroy the vampire. But such is the life of a grave digger...

Object Of The Game:

Try to destroy the vampire by digging up the right grave. You must have three tools (a pick, a shovel and a stake) to dig up and kill the vampire. The phantoms will try to break your tools.

29656.description:
Athens & Sparta is a strategic level block game of the Peloponnesian War, fought from 431BC to 404BC. This war pitted the superior wealth and naval power of Athens against the militarism of Sparta. It was a bloody contest, with many heroic triumphs and great atrocities. Victory by Sparta ended the Golden Age of Greece.

This game provides insight into why the war was fought the way it was. One player controls the wealthy and sea faring Athenians, the other the powerful armies of the Spartans. The object is to control important city-states that dotted the Grecian landscape.

In order to create a fog of war, unit blocks are stood up with the backs facing the opponent. In this manner the opponent cannot tell the type or the strength of the units being deployed against him until battle begins. Along the sides of the unit blocks, only visible to the owner until it comes time for combat, are numbers that represent the strength of the unit. The current strength is on top. As the unit takes losses, it is rotated so a lesser value is on top.
29656.name: Athens & Sparta

29657.name: The Narrowboat Game
29657.description:
From the Game:

Captain your own narrowboat around the canal system. There are locks to negotiate, a tunnel to go through, an aqueduct to cross, as well as hazard squares and detour points to avoid. Breakdown vans are called to repair your boat in the event of mishap. Climb aboard and select your one or two week narrowboating holiday and Good Luck!

This family boating game is for children of all ages, and recommended playing Ages 7 and up.

29658.name: Truchet
29658.description:
Truchet is an abstract strategy game for two players based on a novel tiling of the plane with single type of two sided tile, which results in a variable pattern of rivers and islands which constitute the board. During play, tiles can be flipped which reconfigures the
connectivity of dark and light areas of the board. The standard board size is 7x7.

Each player starts with 12 stackable markers, which can either move along a river, join to form new stacks, or split stacks into multiple smaller pieces. Capturing is by direct replacement. The goal of the game is to capture all of the opponents pieces.

Online Play

Boardspace.net (real-time, AI option)
Gamerz.net (PBEM)

29659.description:
Yula Körlitz, one of the deadliest agents of the Reich, explodes onto the scene of Tannhäuser! Working directly under Reichdoktor Hass Horbringer, Yula is tough, competent, smart, and dangerously lethal. Preferring to work in close quarters, Yula compliments the base forces of the Obscura Korps with her own unique brand of skill and science.

Yula Körlitz is an addition figure for Tannhäuser. The figure will come individually packaged for retail sale, and will include a pre-painted plastic model, reference card and cardboard tokens, and a scenario to introduce Yula into the Tannhäuser universe.
29659.name: Tannhäuser: Yula

29660.name: Glückshaus
29660.description:
Glückshaus is a simple 15th-16th century dicing game popular among mercenaries then and historical re-enactors now. A board shows the numbers from 2-12, excepting 4. Players take turns throwing two dice.

On a 3,5,6,8,9,10,or 11, if the corresponding space holds a coin, they take it; if the space is empty, they place a coin. On a 7 ("the Wedding"), a coin is always placed on the board, forming a growing jackpot. A 2 ("the Pig") takes all the coins except the pile on 7; A 12 takes all the coins on the board. On a 4, nothing happens, or the player may have paid the house, as no 4-space appears on surviving boards.

29661.name: Discovery Channel QUEST the adventure game
29661.description:
From the "Code of Conduct" sheet:
You are a Traveler, on the path to discovery. Throughout your journey you will be asked to face the challenges, adventures and consequences of the choices that you make. On your journey you will be searching for various Treasures. once all the Treasures have been collected, the Traveler with the most Treasures wins.

Contents:

Large game box with one large board 19" X 37"
8 pawns
Timer
Dice
Pads of paper
480 cards.

29662.name: Beany  & Cecil Ring Toss Game
29662.description:
Simple Indoor ring toss game featuring Beany and Cecil the sea sick sea serpent cartoon characters.

The game has pictures of Captain Horatio Huffenpuff, Beany's kindly uncle and the Captain of the Leakin' Lena which takes the pals from one destination to the other. The Captain is always willing to instruct Beany and Cecil on their latest assignment, but refuses to put himself in any personal jeopardy, locking himself in the belowdecks for most of the episodes.
Crowy, the navigator of the Leakin' Lena. He is a crow, and unsurprisingly spends most of his time in the crow's nest. He speaks in a squawky voice and has a tendency to faint dead away whenever the ship encounters some sort of hazard.

Dishonest John, the villain of the piece. He is dressed like a Simon Legree character, and he is constantly scheming to foil Beany and Cecil's adventures. His catchphrase is a sinister "Nya ha ha!". Information Extrapolated from From the wikipedia free encyclopedia;

29663.description:
The lead product of Star Fleet Battles Captain's Edition. This is the fourth edition in the Star Fleet Battles series, and it is the current edition.

There have been two major reprintings of the rules, each of which incorporates some errata and cleanup in the rules in 1999 and 2005. These can be identified by a year printed on the lower part of the front cover.

Re-implements:

Star Fleet Battles
Star Fleet Battles Designer's Edition
Star Fleet Battles Commander's Edition
29663.name: Star Fleet Battles: Captain's Edition Basic Set

29664.name: The New Games Book
29664.description:
This book, released in 1976, includes rules for more than 80 non-traditional games, many of the cooperative ilk. It is an outgrowth of a yearly New Games festival which took place for awhile in the early 1970s.

While the book looks quite dated (seeing the cover, font, and artwork brings to mind the word "peacenik"), it is still quite useful for impromptu games with any number of participants. The book is divided into three segments: games for two, games for a dozen, and games for two dozen (or more).

Interspersed within the game descriptions are some interesting articles about the "New Games Movement." A follow-up book, "More New Games", was released in 1981 and the current director of New Games released "Best New Games" in 2002.

29665.description:
From the rules book:

Grandgammon is a game combining both skill and luck for two to six players. When the game is played by two people it is identical to the game known as backgammon.

Grandgammon is an extension of backgammon permitting the game to be played by more than two players.

Online Play


Gamerz (turn-based, play by email or play by web)
29665.name: Grandgammon

29666.name: Rapid Fire!
29666.description:
Rapid Fire! is a two-player shooting-gallery game in which the object is to knock down targets of the other player's color.

The targets - alternating in red and yellow - rotate on a circular, battery-powered central wheel. Rotating in the opposite direction are blocking pegs, which protect the targets. For younger players, the blocking pegs may be removed.

Players fire marble-like balls (also colored red and yellow to represent the owning player) up slightly inclined ramps from opposite sides of the target gallery, with play continuing until one player has eliminated all of the targets in the opposing player's color.

The whole set-up measures over three feet long when assembled. Unlike many shooting gallery games, the trick here is in the timing of the shots - finding moments when an opponent's target will rotate into view and blocking pegs rotate away - rather than in the aim.

29667.description: A 64 page supplement for AT-43 Initiation Set: Operation Damocles with background and rules for using a United Nations of Ava army in the game. Printed in full color.
29667.name: AT-43 Army Book: U.N.A.

29668.name: I.Q. Games: United States Geography
29668.description:
How well do you know your US Geography?

In this game, one player reads from a list of numbered clues on the back of a card while others try to guess the correct answer. You score five points for guessing after one clue and it declines to one point if all five clues are read. The last clue is a picture of the state in question and various visual clues. Players continue taking turns until all cards have been read. Score is kept on included scorekeeper. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

29669.name: War Cry
29669.description:
These miniatures rules for the Ancient and Medieval periods were first published in 1978 as "War Cry and Battle Lust." The Second edition in 1981 (now called simply "War Cry") featured poster-sized wall charts printed with the combat tables and terrain effects charts.

Second edition War Cry seems to have been the only product ever published in the Judges Guild's "Emperor Series."

29671.name: TrigO
29671.description:
TrigO™ is a creative board game that teaches the rudimentary concepts of trigonometry. The game has six levels of play ranging from beginner to advanced.

Each player receives 6 playing pieces of the same color, one for each of the trigonometric functions. There can be 2 to 6 players.
Players will learn the names of the six major trigonometric functions: SIN, COS, TAN, COT, SEC, CSC. Advanced rules provide you with concepts of the four quadrants and the signs for each function in each quadrant.
Players will learn the ratios of the sides of a right triangle for the six major trigonometric functions. The triangular playing pieces are specially designed to show the direction of rotation for your playing piece around each triangular path.

The simple rules for the novice is called the "Beginners Game" In this game you will learn the names of the six functions and what constitutes a triangle.
In the "Direction Game" a player will find that there is a clockwise and counterclockwise direction of movement.
The "Function Game" requires you to start your playing piece such that it moves onto the numerator for the trigonometric ratio of your playing piece and then onto the denomator for that playing piece.
In the "Many Triangles Game" a player will make use of smaller right triangles to shorten the distance of travel.
In the "Quadrant Game" the player will find that there are four quadrants on the playing board with a specific sign for each trigonometric function as represented by the playing pieces.
In the "Function Sign Game" the player will need to observe the sign for each playing piece for the quadrant it is in.

29672.name: Togg
29672.description:
Another tactical game from Swiss publisher Arte Ludens.
The goal of this abstract game with wooden tiles is to reach the opposite side with your own tiles. But on your way there your tiles may be blocked. You can defend yourself by blocking opposite tiles. You just put yours onto them but avoid running out of tiles.

boardgamehonor.12430: 2007 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "9 years and up" Nominee

29673.name: pendur
29673.description: Each of the 2-7 players tries to put the own tiles next or upon tiles already lying on the table. The tile must be of suitable color/form combination, because not every tile fits in the three-dimensional building concept. Only the player who places his tiles smartly has a chance to win.

29674.name: Kuado
29674.description: Kuado is a highly tactical but quick game in which each of the 2 players tries to put a square of 4 sticks on a foundation of 4 stones. The opposing building of squares can be prevented by blocking with own sticks.

29675.name: Three Crowns
29675.description: Three Crowns is a sophisticated game of pattern-formation, which was designed by Larry Back in 2000 for the 2001 8x8 Game Design Competition co-sponsored by About Board Games, Abstract Games magazine and the Strategy Gaming Society. Every game is a sharp battle. The goal is to crown your pieces, then to build a "crowned troika", a formation of three or more crowned pieces in a straight line, orthogonally or diagonally, all belonging to the same player.

29676.name: Monopoly: Tropical Tycoon DVD Game
29676.description:
Tropical Tycoon is a modified version of Monopoly that incorporates new rules, new pieces, and new winning conditions. It uses a DVD (required) to generate random events.

New additions include:

Players have Jobs that give individual advantages.

In addition to beach houses (houses) and resorts (hotels), properties can be developed with Casinos, Parks, Restaurants, and Piers. The rent for the Casino is pure luck, but sometimes the owner has to pay out to the visitor. Parks don't garner much rent, and what rent they gather is based on the weather, which can change with every Chance or Community Chest event (the Park's main benefit is its worth in Fortune Tokens at game end: A Park on Gentle Sands is the equivalent of four million dollars cash at the end of the game). Piers' rent depends not only on the weather, but also the presence or absence of a cruise ship, which is also affected by the card events. Finally, Restaurants' rent is dependent upon the neighboring property improvements. There are very few of these developments, though, so the competition for them can be fierce!

Although the basic board layout is the same as a standard Monopoly board, there are no Chance and Community Chest cards; when a player lands on one of those two spots, the DVD determines what happens.

One of the dice has a TV symbol in place of the 1-pip; when the TV is rolled, a News Broadcast is played on the DVD, which triggers a random event (much like Chance or Community Chest).

Players collect Fortune Tokens (and earn them at the end of the game through their cash and property holdings). Play ends when one player goes bankrupt (or, alternately, whenever the players decide to stop). The player with the most Fortune Tokens at the end of the game wins.

29677.name: Eat Electric Death!
29677.description:
Eat Electric Death! is the exciting board game of tactical starship combat set in the wild and wacky Weird Worlds universe (made famous in the award-winning computer game Weird Worlds: Return to Infinite Space) for two carbon-based life forms.

Players will command an array of starships from such intergalactic species as the calculating mechanical Tan Ru, the bloodthirsty savage reptilian Garthans, and the noble Zorg, masters of time and space. Annihilation is only a chit pull away as energy weapons, missiles, and even old fashioned projectiles hurdle across the map while ships maneuver for the optimum firing spot. When found shields collapse, bulkheads shatter, and sometimes even a reactor blows. For some, crews will work to repair the damage, while for others salvation is only possible through victory.

Eat Electric Death! plays like a rocket to the stars – fast – with easily understood rules that will have you battling within minutes of opening the box and punching counters. Varied scenario types provide plenty of adventure, and the game lends itself well for telling your own tales. Intuitive playing aids create a minimum of bookkeeping chores while allowing plenty of sci-fi chrome. Starship combat this sleek is rarely seen on your kitchen table.

If you like your aliens ugly, your starships shiny, and your ship on ship action frenzied and fun, then look no further than Eat Electric Death!, your space opera in a box!

boardgamehonor.18932: 2008 JoTa Best Party Board Game Nominee

29678.description:
From the Publisher:
Kill the monster, grab the treasure, stab your buddy. That's what it's all about. Now, Munchkin comes to the boardgame.

Cooperate with the whole group, adventure with a partner, or strike out on your own. You don't know what's behind a door until you open it . . . then another tile is added to the dungeon. Battle monsters for power and treasure, or send them after your friends. Reach Level 10, and then get out alive if you can!

Components:

200 Cards
27 Health Tokens
69 Gold Pieces
12 Dropped Item Tokens
15 Move Tokens
12 Search Result Tokens
4 Level Counters
4 Munchkins
12 Monster Bases
24 Room Tiles
1 Entrance Tile
73 Links
38 Monster Standies
8 6-Sided dice, two for each player
1 10-Sided die
1 six-colored Monster Die
1 20-page rulebook




Part of the Munchkin series
29678.name: Munchkin Quest

29679.description:
Players help the Little Prince protect his planet from Baobab Tree saplings, which, if they grow into full trees, will destroy the Little Prince's planetoid.


Die Spieler helfen dem Kleinen Prinzen, seinen Planeten vor Sprösslingen von Affenbrotbäumen, die so groß werden, dass sie den Planeten zerstören können, zu beschützen.
29679.name: The Little Prince Protects his Planet

29680.description:
With a flock of wild birds, the Little Prince travels from planet to planet. The players help the Little Prince to visit all of the planets in the right order.

Aim of the game (from Rule book):
To help the little prince go travelling and discover as many planets as possible. Beware, each planet must be associated with a flock of birds. In Fact, the prince can only travel if a flock of birds comes to collect him.

On his turn a player turns over an objective card and has 3 attempts to slide stars tiles on the board to discover the planet shown on the objective card and a flock of birds.
If he doesn't manage to do it, next player has three goes.
Fist player to find the good planet and a flock of birds wins the tile. Than next player turn a new objective card.
Once the 8 objective cards have been given, player with the most cards win.

Note:
In the same collection from the publisher Petit Jour, there are two other games with the little prince anthem:
the little Prince protects is planet and the little prince tames the fox.


Mit einem Schwarm wilder Vögel reist der kleine Prinz von Planet zu Planet. Die Spieler sind dem kleinen Prinzen behilflich, alle Planeten in der richtigen Reihenfolge zu besuchen.
29680.name: Der kleine Prinz geht auf die Reise

29681.name: Combat Heroes
29681.description: The game is actually two distinct games, each of which consists of two books. Any book can be used by itself for a (short) solo game. The books can be paired (White Warlord against Black Baron, or Emerald Enchanter against Scarlet Sorcerer) to play a two-player duel.

29682.name: Doodads
29682.description:
“I’ll trade you a cabbage and some duct tape for your toddler.”
A game about trading and building for 3 to 5 players.
Learn what ingredients you need to make things. Turn money into ingredients. Turn ingredients into things. Use your things to give you an advantage over your opponents. Learn what things you need to build doodads. Build doodads out of things. Use your doodads to give you an even greater advantage over your opponents. End the game with the most diverse collection of doodads, things, and ingredients.

The game is freely downloadable on the publisher's site:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/443/Doodads

29683.name: Halfanutz
29683.description:
Halfanutz is a card game about elephants. Tom Wham's younger sisters couldn't say the word elephant when they were toddlers so they said "halfanutz" instead.

The basic game consists of walkabout and scoring phases. In the walkabout phase the player draws a card. Then they can either push their luck and draw another card or they can take the cards they already have behind their screen and pass the turn to somebody else. If they draw a card with the same picture as a card they already have, they lose the cards they've drawn and their turn. After all the cards have been drawn, the scoring phase happens. Players sort their cards by the resource pictured on it, then count the largest pile of cards and subtract the smallest pile of cards. After two sessions the scores are totaled and a winner declared.

The advanced game adds resources and a trick taking phase (called "the rumble"). During the walkabout for each card turned over, the player also gets a resource of the type on the card. The player gets to keep the resource, even if the cards end up being discarded. During the trick taking phase, the players randomly play a card from the cards they have collected. The cards are numbered and the highest number wins. The twist is that your card can be reinforced by resources of the same type as the card played. The players take turns reinforcing their cards or passing. The player with the highest card number + resources played wins the trick. Players then score the number of cards they have taken during the rumble. Again, two sessions are played and the scores are totaled.

The tournament game is like the advanced game, except the card played during the rumble is not chosen randomly.

Halfanutz is self-published by Tom Wham and is available from his web site, http://www.tomwham.com.

29684.description:
Produced by Alchemia in 1994, the Hokuto No Ken collectible card game has been available only in Italy. The card game contains almost every character found in the original anime series and the cards are illustrated with stills taken from the TV show itself.

It is a one vs one game, each player uses his own deck, just like in Magic The Gathering and most of the others CCGs around. The game is now out of print.

Apart from the base set of 200 cards, the following expansion sets have been released:

Il re del mondo (1994)

Le Cinque Forze (1995)

Le Tecniche (1996)

I Demoni (1997)

La Nuova Era (1998)

Le Nuove Cinque Forze (2000)

Sotto il Segno dell'Orsa (special cards given in various conventions)
29684.name: Ken il Guerriero: Gioco di Carte Collezionabili

29685.name: The Salt Birds of Akarah
29685.description:
The Salt Birds of Akarah has elements of both a pickup-and-deliver game and a combat game. Players control a number of birds, each trying to pick up salt crystals, and bring them back to their home base. Along the way, you can freeze and opponent's birds with arctic crystals, zap them with laser beams, and contend with them in an "exciting fruit challenge." The latter uses a guessing game mechanic, where the object is to successfully discard disks that are marked with bad habits, such as "greedy," "obnoxious," "reckless," and "untrustworthy."

The Salt Birds of Akarah has been awarded US Patent number 4927155.

The inventive game may be played by from two to four players, each one of which has a home base game piece and a plurality of salt birds. At the beginning of the game, the home bases and a plurality of other game pieces are placed on the game board in a prescribed manner including a plurality of salt tablets. Each player has a plurality of bird game pieces for movement on the board. Each player has a plurality of discs describing various bad habits. The object of the game for each player is to obtain a predetermined number of salt tablets by moving their bird game pieces and landing on the spaces having salt tablets, then returning the obtained salt tablets to their home bases while getting rid of their bad habit discs.

29686.name: Gridfun
29686.description: From the rules: "Gridfun is a football game, employing three dials with spinners, one for kicking, one for running and one for forward passing."

29687.description:
Leaping Lemmings - The Original Cliff Divers

Leaping Lemmings is a humorous game for 2-6 players. Each player controls a cloned clan of lemmings that have been specially trained to compete with the other lemming clans, all trying to scurry down a canyon and hurl themselves over a cliff. Distance and style points are important. One lemming diving with style and élan is worth as many as five of the more mundane divers. But beware the hungry eagles circling overhead or your lemmings might not even make the cliff edge!

Objective: The player with the most victory points wins the game. To earn victory points, players dive their lemmings over the cliff edge and/or collect Lemming Chow Pellets.

The game board is a hex-based map representing the canyon down which up to six separate lemming clans will travel. The canyon ends with the cliff edge hexes, which are the lemmings' ultimate goal. Between the lemmings and their goal there are two eagles circling overhead hoping for multiple lemming snacks.

Each turn a movement card is revealed which will allow for 2-5 lemming movement points. Card luck is mitigated in that all players use the same card to move that turn. Only the top lemming in each stack is allowed to move, so covering your opponents' lemmings is one tactic that is used to slow them down. The down side is that the top lemming in each stack is the only one in danger of becoming eagle chow.

Special Actions allow players to briefly alter the normal rules of the game to their advantage or to their opponents' detriment. There are 16 different Special Actions in the game.

Home Page: http://www.gmtgames.com/p-143-leaping-lemmings.aspx
29687.name: Leaping Lemmings

29688.description:
This is the Bill Leeson´s reprint of the English translation of von Tschischwitz game, originally published in 1862. The game asks for at least 3 players, one acting as umpire, of a war scenario set previously by this same umpire. 3 sets of maps are used; one for every team with limited information and an overall one for the umpire with the position of both teams.
The book includes the tables necessary to play as well as a scenario about an invasion of Bohemia.
No verbal communication is allowed for the players, even if in the same team (except to those who are in the same spot); all must be done by means of couriers who bring the messages from one part of the battlefield to another (this is translated as a time delay among the communications of the players)
The different teams are given a map and a set of troops and some objectives to fulfill, while the umpire keeps good note of the development of both teams.
Basically, the game procedure is as follows:
a) The umpire states the number of moves to be made
b) Each commander in succession states what movements he wants to make; the forces are then moved by the umpire
c) The umpire decides of the success or failure of an attack due to the given tables
d) Losses are reckoned and noted
So soon the umpire has the movements, no corrections can be made for that same movement.
29688.name: Rules for the Conduct of the War-Game

29689.name: Vanguard: Men At Arms
29689.description:
Vanguard: Men At Arms is a set of miniatures wargame rules aimed at gaming small scale skirmish actions between the 12th and 15th Century.

Players can control a dozen or more soldiers in fast and bloody clashes with their opponent as they try to raid, ravage and wreak havoc in enemy territory.

Each figure on the table represents 2-5 men, with a ground scale of 5 yards to the inch. Therefore a game between two forces of twenty men on a 6' x 4' table will represent about 70 soldiers per side fighting across an area about a quarter of a mile across.

29690.description:
This game contains twelve scenarios for the Advanced Squad Leader system, detailing the conflicts between Finland and Russia as well as Germany during WWII. Components include 106 new counters and two 8.5" X 11" mounted maps.

Ownership of Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1 is required for play. However, it is printed to be consistent with the First Edition of Beyond Valor.
29690.name: Finland at War, v. I: Jatkosota

boardgamehonor.10956: 2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Magazine-Published Boardgame Nominee

29691.description:
At the climax of the American Civil War the armies of the Confederacy were pressed back into their heartland as the rebellion tried desperately to sustain itself against Union forces. One of the most important campaigns occurred in southeastern Tennessee and Georgia, as Federal armies pressed toward the Confederacy’s vital city of Atlanta, home to much of its remaining industry and gateway to the southern and western lands the Confederates still held. The campaign for and siege of this vital city broke the power of the Army of Tennessee, the key rebel command outside northern Virginia.

The theater of these operations is roughly bounded by the Tennessee River to the north, the Chattanooga area to the west, Atlanta to the south, and the Appalachian Mountains to the east. It was here where the formidable Union command team of Sherman and Thomas plied their trade, dooming the Confederacy's last chance to survive the Yankee onslaught. Here too the soldiers of the rebel Army of Tennessee fought stubbornly to defend their homes.

Look Away! The Fall of Atlanta is a strategic-operational simulation of the Army of Tennessee's campaigns in the Georgia theater of the Civil War. The game covers the fighting between Union and Confederate forces in Tennessee and northern Georgia during the spring and summer of 1864. Each hexagon represents an area roughly 2.6 miles in diameter (4 km). Each turn in the game represents about four days of real time. There are four scenarios dealing with the major engagements of the war plus a campaign game covering the entire period.

Look Away is the third game in John Prados' series on the American Civil War, following The Campaigns of Robert E. Lee and The Army of the Heartland: The Army of Tennessee's Campaigns, 1861-1863.
29691.name: Look Away!

boardgamefamily.23560: John Prados American Civil War Campaigns

29693.name: Museum Pictoris
29693.description:
Museum Pictoris is the board game in which players become great collectors of painting masterpieces.

The players will be able to compete collecting, buying and selling the best paintings of the History of Art.

Museum Pictoris is recommended for any age, from 8 years and up. Museum Pictoris is the best way to go deeply into the fascinating world of the History of Art. It is not necessary to have any knowledge about art to play and win, but after a few games and without any effort at all, one will become an art expert.

Museum Pictoris includes 144 high quality reproductions of painting masterpieces, selected among 50 museums worldwide, of 89 great artists from the XIV century Gothic Style to the XIX century Romantic Style.

Museum Pictoris is much more than just a game; it is a fascinating trip through the History of Art.

Home Page: http://www.museum-pictoris.com

29694.description:
Die kleine Hexe is a game based on the childs book by Otfried Preußler (published in English as: The little Witch). The players move the little witch and her raven Abraxas around to help them do her good works. If they succeed within a set number of rounds, all players win (the player who helped most wins a little bit more). Otherwise, all players lose.

The playing field consists of the inside of the box, which is filled with a number of steeples with loose tops. Above them, held by wooden sticks in the corner of the box, is the (cardboard) sky. The little witch moves on her broom among the churches, held and led by a magnet above the sky.

There are 13 cards (hidden after the games starts) showing the good tasks, each with a colored chip corresponding to a location in the 'city'. In each player turn a task gets selected. The player now has to remember the correct card and fly the little witch between the high church towers to the correct location, without accidentally knocking down one of the tipsy tops.
29694.name: Die kleine Hexe

29695.description:
From the publishers website:

Roman Glory was created specifically to fill the worldwide demand for an ASLComp Historical Module depicted Italian forces on the Eastern Front.

Created by Italian Andrea Garello the set consists of four highly replayable scenarios, special rules sheet, and historical map of Nikitovka.

Roman Glory is not a complete game. You will need to own Beyond Valor and Hollow Legions to use this product.

Roman Glory Series — This product is the first of a series of ASLComp. expansions depicting the Italian Army on the Eastern Front of World War II. Designer Andrea Garello is currently completing two new expansions, depicting actions at Novo Orlovka and Orlovo Ivanovka and providing new maps.

Expands:

Beyond Valor
Hollow Legions
29695.name: Roman Glory

29696.name: Le jeu du loup
29696.description:
From the back of the box: ``Quick, quick! ... In order to win you must gather all your items before the wolf has all its clothes on. The players take turn drawing from the bag, but be careful, if the wolf's head appears, you have to put an item of clothing on him! This fun game is suitable for players of 3 years and over because there are three versions of the game: all together, one against another or alone... But always against the Wolf.

The game comes with a board representing a forest, onto which six different kinds of items are spread: mushrooms, strawberries, snails, blackberries, flowers and butterflies. In addition, each player receives one leaf-shaped individual board that is uniformly green on one side (for using in cooperative mode), and covered with the shapes of five of the six items on the other side (used in competitive and individual modes). The wolf is drawn on a magnetic board and its five items of clothing (shoes, trousers, jacket, hat and umbrella) are magnetic too. In the bag, eight cardboard discs represent each of the six items that can be picked from the forest, plus the head of the wolf and a clover leaf.

The players draw in turn one disc from the bag. If the wolf's head is drawn, they put an item of clothing onto the wolf. If it is the clover leaf, they can take one item of clothing off the wolf or choose one item of their choice from the forest (competitive and individual mode) or two items from the forest (cooperative mode). Otherwise, they take the item represented on the disc from the forest. The disc is then put back in the bag and passed to the next player.

In competitive mode, the winner is the first player who manages to pick up all the items represented on his board. In cooperative mode, the players win if they manage to empty the forest before the wolf is fully clothed. In individual mode, the player wins if he manages to pick up all the items represented on his board. The game is lost in any mode if the wolf gets all its clothes on.

29697.name: Lilla Anna och Långa Farbrorns Tårtspel
29697.description:
Roll the die and move. If you end at a blue square take a blue card. If you end at a red square, take a red one and make an imitation of the animal shown. Then take a blue card.

When you have two identical blue cards you may trade them against a "cake card". The first player with four "cake cards" is the winner.

29698.name: OOPS!! Travel Card Game
29698.description:
Game consists of cards and "speedometer" dials for players to keep score. On one's turn, one draws a card and moves one's speedometer pointer the number of mph indicated. If one goes over 65 mph, a penalty of reducing one's speed is incurred.

The first player to land exactly on 65 mph wins.

29699.name: Dead Man's Island
29699.description:
Print and play micro wargame. From the ad copy on RPG Now:

Pirates & Treasure & Zombies, Oh My!

When pirates defile graves just for some easy gold, you know there will be trouble, especially when it's a witch's treasure buried in a graveyard for the most notorious of sea dogs.

Easy gold it won't be with other pirates after it and the dead raising to take you to their side. Will you become rich and retire to a life of leisure or will the grave you are digging up become your own?

Dead Man's Island is a strategy adventure for 1 to 4 players Ages 10 and up

29700.name: Memorico
29700.description:
From Publishers Website:

Using three pack of Memo-Rico cards, players can engage in up to four captivating and educational games, designed to help youngsters know their multiplications like the backs of their hands! In groups or alone, learning has never been so fun and easy!

Suggested Ages & Up

29701.name: Epyx VCR Golf
29701.description:
Epyx VCR Golf features 18 different holes from the world's most famed golf courses. Pinehurst, Jupiter Hills, Miami's Doral Country Club and other equally spectacular courses. Epyx VCR Golf tests the very soul of classic golf strategy.

Play against yourself, against an opponent or three opponents. You move the ball from tee to green deciding each shot along the way. There are three ways a player can make a stroke: You can select a club card which includes a predetermined shot distance. You can roll the dice once you hit the green. Or you can play the videocassette featuring real live action footage, courtesy of ABC Sports and the PGA of America. And all the pros are there.

But, of course, the hottest pro on the tour is somebody you're very familiar with, You. You're the one who decides everything. Beginning to feel the pressure?

29702.name: Shaun of the Dead Card Game
29702.description:
This is a fast paced 'print and play' card game based around the hit UK film Shaun of the Dead. You must help your group to survive against an onslaught of zombie attacks by using innovative weapons such as cricket bats, spades, darts and even a Dire Straits record!

To get this game for free, go to the address below;

http://mmboardgames.page.tl/

Shaun of the Dead is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorised, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

29703.name: Bewitched Card Game
29703.description:
This is a fast paced 'print and play' card game based around the hit classic TV show Bewitched. Samantha the witch married mortal Darrin much to the dismay of her family. You must try to make their marriage succeed and stop Samantha’s family from interfering and transforming Darrin in to all manner of things including a chimp, a little boy and even a fish!

Bewitched is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.

29704.name: UNO: High School Musical
29704.description:
The usual Uno (including themed editions without new cards) rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

Based on the Disney Channel Movie High School Musical.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Duet Card' There are 4 pairs of characters in th "High School Musical." When you play the Duet card, all other players must discard one of the pairs from their hand (2 cards). If a player cannot discard a pair, they must draw 2 cards from the DRAW pile and add those cards to their hand.

29705.name: WrestleFest
29705.description:
WrestleFest is a table-top dice rolling game with mini's, based on wrestling. It has over 150 wrestlers, managers, and officials, and 9 match types. Match types include, Cage, Barbed Wire, and Ladder. WrestleFest also includes 8 different ring types.

'WrestleFest's minis, rings, and more are all print-and-play! Download from the WrestleFest website.

Home Page: http://www.wrestlefestonline.com/

29706.name: Shichi Narabe
29706.description:
Shichi Narabe is a card game closely related to Fan Tan (another card game not to be confused with the gambling game known by the same name); both games are frequently known as "Sevens", adding to the confusion.

In Shichi Narabe, a traditional card deck is dealt out; players place all 7s onto the table. From there, players may play cards higher than the highest card currently on the table, or lower than the lowest card. (Aces are low). The game is described at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shichi_narabe.

The primary difference from Fan Tan (the card game) is that in Fan Tan, the 7s are not played to the table to start the game.

29707.description:
2 distinct games in each box. The first is for 2 -4 players Ages 4 and up. That game has its own board and is basically a go around the path trying to join the circus first by matching colors.

The second game with its own board on the reverse side is also for 2-4 players Ages 7 and up and requires that the players go around the Big Top following simple directions in order to get extra turns, or special moves along the way.

Game includes one two-sided game board, one yellow hat, 4 tally cards, 4 pawns 30 tokens and 40 cards.
29707.name: Curious George Adventures:  Joins the Circus

29708.name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: The Doomsday Device
29708.description: The eighth game in the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks pits Marvel Comics' Fantastic Four against Dr. Doom.

29709.name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: Warlords
29709.description:
A Samuri vs. Samurai battle in the setting of AD&D Oriental Adventures. One player plays Prince Matabei, the rebel commander. The other player plays Lord Kenshin, the Daimyo of Tsuke.

Part of the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks.

29710.name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: Dragonsword of Lankhmar
29710.description:
Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser vs. The Thieves' Guild Assassins. The heroes attempt to complete a quest while the guild sends wave after wave of villains to stop them.

Part of the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks.

29711.name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: Revenge of the Red Dragon
29711.description:
A game of knight vs. dragon.

The knight, Raven Quickblade, must recover stolen treasure from the dragon and escape. The dragon, Flametongue, must reclaim a friend the knight kidnapped on the way out.

Part of the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks.

29712.description:
You Are Ar-Kane, a Great Wizard (Book One Title)
You Are Renwood, a Powerful Druid (Book Two Title)

Challenge of Druid's Grove is the fourth One-on-One Adventure Gamebook, and involves a race between the representatives of two different factions who are trying to capture each other for ransom while trying to stop a growing evil in the forest of Laith. There are two books in the box set, one for the player of the wizard Ar-Kane and one for the player of the druid Renwood. Players move their characters from location to location, collect items, come into conflict.
29712.name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: Challenge of Druid's Grove

29713.description: The tenth game in the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks is set in the world of Dragonlance. One player plays Lord Ariakan, Dragon Highlord. The other player plays Lord Patrick, Knight of Solamnia.
29713.name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: The Dragonwand of Krynn

29714.description:
In March 1999 five expansions for the Catan Card Game were published. Zauberer & Drachen (Wizards & Dragons) contains 45 new cards. Ideas from players around the world were included in the expansions.

Focus in this expansion is on magic (a new 'resource') and introduces a new central Citadel card.

45 cards

Expands:

Catan Card Game
29714.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Kartenspiel – Zauberer & Drachen

29715.description:
In March 1999 five expansions for the Catan Card Game were published. Handel & Wandel (Trade & Change) contains 30 new cards. Ideas from players around the world were included in the expansions.

Focus in this expansion is on trading and resources.

30 cards
29715.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Kartenspiel – Handel & Wandel

29716.description:
In March 1999 five expansions for the Catan Card Game were published. Politik & Intrige (Politics & Intrigue) contains 30 new cards. Ideas from players around the world were included in the expansions.

Focus in this expansion is on more interaction between players and introduces the Metropolis - a central card giving players more space to build.

30 cards
29716.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Kartenspiel – Politik & Intrige

29717.description:
In March 1999 five expansions for the Catan Card Game were published. Wissenschaft & Fortschritt (Science & Progress) contains 28 cards from the 1997 Turnier-Set and two new cards. Ideas from players around the world were included in the expansions.

Focus in this expansion is on inventions and technology with cards as the University and the cannon.

30 cards
Ages 12 and up
Illustrations: Franz Vohwinkel
29717.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Kartenspiel – Wissenschaft & Fortschritt

29718.description:
In March 1999 five expansions for the Catan Card Game were published. Ritter & Händler (Knights & Merchants) contains 29 cards from the 1997 Turnier-Set and one new card. Ideas from players around the world were included in the expansions.

Focus in this expansion is on conflict and trade fleets.

30 cards
29718.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Kartenspiel – Ritter & Händler

29719.description:
From designers Ottavio Ricchi and Lorenzo Striuli! In the summer of 1941, Italian dictator Benito Mussolini dispatched a corps of three divisions to fight alongside the Germans in their invasion of the Soviet Union. The CSIR arrived at the front in August and soon engaged in combat with the Red Army.

Fronte Russo brings background articles and scenarios covering these crack troops and their battles to the Panzer Grenadier game system. It is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Eastern Front to play most of the scenarios, and Road to Berlin to play all of them. This is a book supplement complete with a full set of die-cut and mounted counters, much like Sinister Forces and East of Suez.

Scenarios take place on the Eastern Front. The Italian divisions sent to Russia — the Pasubio and Torino infantry divisions and Duca d’Aosta cavalry division — were well-trained units of the regular army, though not well equipped by most standards. Background articles place the scenarios in the full context of the Italian war in Russia.

This game is part of the Panzer Grenadier series
29719.name: Panzer Grenadier: Fronte Russo

29720.name: Amigos
29720.description: Playing Amigos helps you to get to know your friends even better. During each round a player takes a card from one of the three piles (Action, Fantasy or Psycho pile) and reads the question on the card to one of the other players who has to answer this question. The other players have to judge the answer. You don't have to tell the truth when you give the answer, the only thing that matters is that the others believe it. He who scores best in this part of the game will end up as the winner.

29722.name: SpeelBank
29722.description:
Players are director of a bank and will invest in products, develop and bring them to the market.

At the beginning of the game everyone receives a card which states which products are to be purchased. With some starting money and one first random product, every turn dice are rolled and paws moved. The board shows all available products, and whenever the player lands on a product space he can either buy it, or must pay the current owner.
Besides product cards there are positive and negative cards which must be drawn when landing on the subsequent space.
The winner is the one who first succeeds to collect the products on his card.

This game was released in 1997 at the 100th anniversary of the Rabobank in The Netherlands. All cards and components are Dutch.

29723.name: Dymonds
29723.description: An abstract games played with chess pieces on a rotated chess board. There are two kind of pieces, Kings and Jacks. The object of the game is either to capture the opponent King or to reach the opponent "King Triangle" i.e. the opponent's home base.

29724.name: Tracks: The Unique Railroad Quiz Game
29724.description:
A trivia game about railroads. Players roll a die marked with the letters T, R, A, C, K, and S and answer questions in the corresponding categories: T=Early Railroad History, R=Lingo, A=Famous Names and Places, C=Technical Data and Reporting Marks, K=Passenger Trains and Logos, S=Pot-Pourri (sic).

Correct answers are worth 5 points. Whether a correct answer is made or not, a player's turn is over after they answer.
The game can end one of two ways. First, if a player can roll the letters in the same sequence as the title on their turns (and successfully answer the corresponding questions), they win the game upon the completion of answering the last question. Since this will prove to be rather rare, the first player to reach 50 points wins.

The game questions can also be used with Trivial Pursuit or other trivia games.

The game's box includes the aforementioned die, 500 cards with 3,000 questions (500 from each category), rules, a category summary sheet and a surprisingly large amount of information on the cover artist (in spite of the game including no information on the actual designer of the game).

29725.description:
A strategic-level game on the Anglo-Boer War of 1899-1902.

One turn = one month
One hex = 15 miles
One strength point = 500 men (British), 333 men (Boers)

Components: one standard-size game map, one sheet of counters, and a rule book.

Scenarios include the Traditional War, the Guerrilla War, and the Campaign Game.

The game was included with the 3W game The Defense of Rorke's Drift, but is a completely separate game.

ONE MUST OBTAIN THE DEFENSE OF RORKE'S DRIFT GAME IN ORDER TO GET THIS GAME.
29725.name: The Boer War

29726.name: Baseball
29726.description:
This version of baseball was produced in 1941 by Milton Bradley. It is a physical dexterity game that uses a thick cardboard bat about 3.4" long, with a wood semi-circle glued to the underside about 1/3 in from the handle, and with a small hole near the tip of the bat. There are 8 small glass balls, 4 white and 4 black. The cardboard playing field is inset into the box bottom, and is punched with a variety of holes.

The rules on the side of the box say that when batting, a player puts the bat about 2" from the home-plate corner of the box, mounts a ball of his color on the hole in the bat, and then brings down his finger with a sharp blow to the bat handle. This launches the ball up and onto the playing field. Falling into one of four large oblong holes around the pitcher's mound is a strike. Dropping into the round hole near each fielder is an out. Dropping into any of the numbered holes is a safe hit of that many bases. There is a home run hole in deep center field. If a launched ball fails to fall into any of the holes, it is a ball. Three strikes cause an out, while four balls of course generate a walk. Successful hits are marked by putting balls into holes on the appropriate bases before batting again.

The game can be found listed in "Baseball Games from Antique Baseball to Modern Baseball Sims".

29728.name: Spy Kids: Mission Master
29728.description:
Objective 1: Be the first to finish all missions.
Objective 2: Avoid the Thumb Thumbs!
Objective 3: Become the ultimate OSS spy!

In this advanced Spy Kids board game, you are working as an OSS spy to help solve important missions.

Control the OSS operatives as they work their way around from mission to mission as quickly as possible. This is no time for fooling around. The Thumb Thumbs are a serious threat to take over the world! They have stolen secret documents, planted booby traps, invaded sensitive buildings, and have created chaos everywhere. The OSS team needs YOU to help stop the Thunb Thumbs!

Be the first to complete every mission and become the ultimate OSS Spy! Work quickly and find the fastest route to each targeted mission. Be on the look-out for the evil Thumb Thumbs, who have been sent out to stop you from saving the world.

29729.name: Quest of Efil
29729.description:
Quest of Efil is played on three boards, each at a different scale. One board shows a world map, one is for arranging a group of dungeon-like mazes, and the third is for tactical battles. Players take on a role, each described on a character card. These include a hero, a wizard, a master thief, a dwarf king, a cyborg, and a ninja.

Players complete a series of quests, each of which has the aim of collecting an item to be used in defeating the final enemy. Quest of Efil has been awarded US Patent number 5476264.

29730.description: Go Diego Go! Treasure Quest is a roll and move game where each player is trying to collect a "Play Scene Board" which is a picture of a location like a desert or waterfall. Once all the players collect a Play Scene Board and make it to the Treasure Chest to find Baby Jaguar, the Play Scene Boards are used to create stories using Colorforms Stick-Ons of Diego and his pals.
29730.name: Go Diego Go! Treasure Quest

29731.name: Armada
29731.description:
Up to 4 captains try to lead their ships into their harbor. But there is some danger of being bombed. And the wind has to blow in the right direction...
This is one of the big boxes of Clipper. It contains beautiful material, such as ships and windroses.

29732.name: 99 Nightmare Street
29732.description:
From the box: A speedy spooky numbers game!

Mr and Mrs Morbid are throwing their annual Halloween party. As usual they've invited some very strange guests... and you've been given the job of answering the door to them all!

You've got to keep track of how many peculiar characters arrive and leave because Mr and Mrs Morbid have invited more spooks that their creepy house can hold!

You can't turn any guests away, but you're in trouble if you let more than 99 guests in!

29733.name: Monster!
29733.description:
From the box: A mad game of well-mannered monster mayhem!

General Gargoyle has a strange collection of pets. They are some of the weirdest looking creatures you have ever seen. General Gargoyle sometimes has a bit of trouble controlling his crazy creatures - it's the third time this week that the monsters have sneaked out, and the General has enlisted your help to catch them all, for which he is offering a reward!

So catch as many monsters as you can! But beware, the reward that the General is offering is extremely generous, so others will be trying to capture the monsters too!

29734.name: Clusters Word Building Game
29734.description:
Notes on game from publisher:

This entertaining and captivating word-building game includes 100 plastic tiles in 9 bright colours, representing all of the common letter groupings. Players will discover that words are built with different letter patterns that represent different units of sound. Unique 2-tiered tile racks provide up to 4 players with workspaces to create their own words in preparation for play. Tiles include consonants, consonant digraphs, consonant clusters (blends), short vowels, long vowel digraphs and r-controlled vowel digraphs. The colour coding of each tile separates these letter groups in accordance with the Smart Phonics system.

29735.name: ESPN 21st Century Trivia
29735.description:
"Trifecta…you betcha'!" ESPN 21st Century Trivia brings your favorite sports indoors with 21st Century sports trivia questions and fast-action game play including Chalk Talk and Instant Replay challenges to get your head thinking and your heart pumping.

"He shoots…he scores!" Beat the shot clock as you battle your opponents, race around the board and win the game. "You…could…go…all…the…way" by answering 1,000 questions about your favorite sports like football, skateboarding, BMX racing, baseball, college and more!

Get your adrenaline rush by picking a "Chalk Talk" card and sketch sports terms like "Kiss the glass", "Snow cone" or "Half pipe"; or pick an "Instant Replay" card and act out "Hail Mary", "No look pass" or "SportsCenter". This game's "got more flavor than Kool-Aid and cocoa!" "Boo-yah!"

Game includes 1,000 trivia questions, 150 "Talk Chalk" and "Instant Replay" challenges, stopwatch, game board and 4 movers.

29736.description:
Travel back to New York's golden age of gangsters, where you get to take on the role of a crime boss in 1950's Little Italy. Make your rounds about town as you pick up money from different buildings, but watch out for the "heat"!

Each crime boss shares control of two cars, each with a different opponent. Drive through the streets, timing it right to collect money and avoid the police.

Play strategically, and you'll be able to drive your opponents straight into a stakeout, costing them big money while you collect the big score. If you don't, you'll find yourself sleeping with the fishes!
29736.name: Little Italy

29737.name: Bait Bazi
29737.description:
Bait Bazi is a verbal game and a genre of Urdu poetry played by composing verses of Urdu poems. The game is common among Urdu speakers in Pakistan and India.

The game starts with the first person reciting a stanza of a poem. The next player has to reply with another verse starting with the last letter of the verse used by the previous player and so on.

A verse that has already been used in a game may not be repeated. The rules used by experienced players can be more stringent, such as allowing the use of only one poet's verses or of one theme.

29738.name: Sic Bo
29738.description:
Sic bo, also known as tai sai, dai siu, big and small or hi-lo, is an unequal game of chance played with three dice, and of ancient Chinese origin. Grand hazard and chuck-a-luck are variants, and of English origin. The literal meanings of sic bo, tai sai and dai siu are dice pair or dice bowl, lucky dice and big small respectively.

Sic bo is a casino game, popular in Asia and widely played (as dai siu) in casinos in Macau. It is played in the Philippines as hi-lo. It was introduced into the USA by Chinese immigrants in the early 20th century, and can now be found in most American casinos. Since 13 May 2002, it can be played legally in licensed casinos in the United Kingdom.

29739.name: Ngau
29739.description:
The name means 'Ox' in Cantonese. It is a card game originating in Malaysia, played both casually and as a gambling game. The game uses a standard deck of 52 cards.

Players are dealt 5 cards each, and players try to guess the values of cards in other players' hands.

29740.name: Giog
29740.description:
Giog uses Xiangqi Pieces but no board. All players help to scramble the 32 pieces face down and distribute the pieces evenly to themselves. If the number of players is three, the winner of the previous game or a volunteer receives 12 pieces and the other two players receive 10 pieces each. Like a Mahjong game, each player arranges his/her pieces into one line with half of the pieces on top of the other half.

Play is very similar to the Western card game 'Hearts', inasmuch as players reveal pieces in turn and whoever has the highest ranking piece being the winner. Should there be a tie among some players, they apply the same procedures again by revealing more lower pieces until the order is finally determined.

The player who played the strongest combinations of a same type (as what the round-starter played) wins that round. If there is a tie, the round-starter always wins, or the order of players determines the winner. For example, if the first and fourth player play the same combinations, first player wins unless fourth player is the round-starter. The winner of a round collects the won pieces and starts a new round. The game is played until all pieces are exhausted. The game will go to the player who wins most pieces.

29741.description:
Banqi, or Half Chess, is a two-player Chinese board game played on a 4x8 grid (usually half of the Chinese Chess board). Banqi is a social game, usually played for fun rather than serious competition. Because it has a significant element of chance, some people consider it a child's game, but Banqi often has remarkable depth of strategy.

The 32 pieces are shuffled and randomly allocated face-down to squares on the board. The first player turns up a piece to begin the game. The color of the piece he turns up is the color he will play in the game. The second player then makes a move, and the two alternate until the game is finished.

The game ends when a player cannot move; the player who cannot move loses. Most often, the game is lost because all of a player’s pieces have been captured and so he has no pieces to move. However, it is possible for one player to surround all of the other player’s pieces in a manner that makes it impossible for them to move.
29741.name: Banqi

29742.description:
From the front cover:

Ordeal Before Shuri provides eight individual scenarios and a new campaign game depicting the assault of the American 96th and 27th Divisions against the Japanese garrison on Okinawa. You'll also receive new rules for additional weaponry, such as the Japanese 330mm 'Spigot' mortar, VT Fuses, and 4.5 inch Air to Ground Rockets, plus extensive play aids and charts. The terrain is inhospitable as any Pacific battlefield faced by American soldiers during the Second World War and each individual terrain feature is faithfully depicted on the game map. Ordeal Before Shuri is the beginning of a three-game series of modules depicting the Battle of Okinawa.

Another Squads & Leaders compatible module from Critical Hit!
29742.name: Ordeal Before Shuri

29743.name: Afvalwijzer
29743.description: In Dutch game Afvalwijzer the players have to cope with 6 types of garbage. This could be a bag of chips, an empty package of cigarettes, ... In the centre lies the board with on it twice every location. By using die, the players walk around the board, whenever they get at a location where they can dump their garbage-cards, they can do so. He who manages to get rid of his garbage at the right location before his opponents, wins the game.

29744.name: Line Drive
29744.description: Simple card game which has a number of options depending on which card you select. Game comes with Field as part of the Game Box, a set of cards for both players, score sheets, 4 markers to show players on the base paths and an instruction pamphlet.

29745.name: Air Trafic
29745.description: In Air Trafic, a game published at the end of the '70s or early '80s by Nathan, the players manage an air company. he who earns the most money wins the game.

29746.description:
Help Maisy find her favorite things and then take her to some of her favorite places!

Maisy's Hide and Seek Adventure game is perfect for young children ready to play their fist board game! The simple, easy to follow instructions enables players to practice these important skills:

Color matching - players roll the color die and move to the space that matches the color rolled.

Memory - if they land on a space that pictures an object, they must try to find the chip that contains the matching object. In order to be successful, the player needs to remember where certain objects are hidden!

Taking turns - a child's first game experience teaches cooperation and consideration for others.

Following in sequence - to be successful, the players need to follow their given path and get Maisy to her favorite place.

Cooperating, winning and losing graciously - an important lesson to learn early in life!

There are 3 versions of play that vary in degree of difficulty.
29746.name: Maisy's hide and seek adventure game

29747.description:
It has copyright 1967 R.G. Bryant

It's an Abstract Strategy game, played on a 16x16 grid, 20 pieces to a side, each on own colour. each corner has a 3x3 area that is not playable.

Pieces can move different amounts as per pre game arrangement. by single squares, by one or two squares, one or 3, one of 4, or one or 5, through open squares only. Moves are diagonally backwards or forward, sideways or circular (not really explained in the rules)

three ways to capture (albeit one would be rare as you have to move into a capture position, they call it a 'blunder')

others are by landing on a square not of your colour (again not easy to see how that happens)

Or by having a piece on opposite sides of an opponent's piece.

The three options sound like designer was trying to add depth with options that will rarely come into play

The copy must be Canadian since it's in both English and French. I am in Canada too.

Box is simple, checkerboard design, with nothing more than name and the copyright info.

pieces are plastic, stamped '220' simple. but nice

29748.name: Disney's The Hunchback of Notre Dame Festival of Fools Card Game
29748.description:
It's the Festival of Fools and all Paris is a carnival for Quasimodo, Esmeralda and your other friends. You want to get all the heroes together - and keep away from that villain Frollo. When the bells of Notre Dame show up, there'll be big changes in the game. And a Festival of Fools card means one of you may become the King of Fools! (Don't worry, you can undo the spell.) The first player who collects one each of the heroes - Quasimodo, Esmeralda, Phoebus, Clopin, Djali, and the Gargoyles, wins.

Contents: 54 playing cards

Ages 5 and up

29749.name: The G.S.T.
29749.description:
G.S.T. The Game!! Have Fun!!

Brian's Biggest Blooper

You hated it!!!
You paid a committee to study it!!!
Now play it!!

3 strikes you're out
3 stripes you're in
Government pays
One Million for painting

Your chance to laugh at the government.

Take the role of one (or more) of 10 different occupations and travel around the board following the instructions in the square you land on. Draw cards, read them out loud, and follow those instructions. You can change occupations in the middle of the game by landing on the Reincarnation square.

A simple game and *very* Canadian-centric.

29750.description: A guessing a verbalizing children's game where the goal is to collect the most beetles.
29750.name: Kullerkäfer

29751.name: Golden Curls
29751.description: This is a dice rolling game which tries to simulate the game of Curling, with simple rules for 2 individual players or 2 teams of players Ages 9 and up. Draws, blank ends, hit and roll, takeouts, peels, steals and more but best of all there’s absolutely no sweeping to do!

29752.name: He Scores Ice Hockey Game
29752.description: This game combines all the thrills of real hockey and is played on a board representing the ice surface. Players are shown in both Red and Blue. The game has two dice and a puck which is moved through squares in the direction and by the distance of what was rolled on the dice. Game appears to feature pictures of both the Montreal Canadians and the Toronto Maple Leafs.

29753.name: All Star Hockey Game
29753.description: Old Hockey Game. Not much information is available for this game. Board (rink) is marked off in squares and the pawns used to represent players move from square to square depending on a die roll.

29754.name: Draft Choice: Choix Au Repechage
29754.description: The idea behind this game is to simulate the NHL draft and the operation of a team. 6 teams are included in the game Toronto, Philadelphia, Minnesota, Boston, Montreal and New York. the game board is an ice rink with a superimposed chart on it. the chart has 6 columns each representing one of the teams in the game. Object of the game is to allow players to participate in a number of transactions that occur in the NHL such as drafting players at the start of the season and then making changes to the team during the season. There are two decks of cards included, one titled "Starting Team Player Cards" and the other "Standard Player Cards" A third deck is titled "Vouchers" and is used in relation to draft choices. Object is to wind up with the best possible team.

29755.name: Double Game: The City of Shadows
29755.description:
The "Double Game" series of books uses a combat and inventory system familiar to many "fighting fantasy" style books. But this one allows two players to play simultaneously (each using a different book of the pair). The books use cross-reference tables to allow the players to interact with each other (cooperating or otherwise) at certain points.

One player player plays Coreus, the Prince. The other plays the Bardik, the Thief.

29756.name: Double Game: The Glade of Dreams
29756.description:
The "Double Game" series of books uses a combat and inventory system familiar to many "fighting fantasy" style books. But this one allows two players to play simultaneously (each using a different book of the pair). The books use cross-reference tables to allow the players to interact with each other (usually cooperating) at certain points.

One player player plays Darian, the Master Magician. The other plays the Issel, the Warrior King.

29757.name: UNO: Shrek
29757.description:
The usual Uno (including themed editions without new cards) rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points.
