In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

Based on the Dream Works film Shrek 3.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Merlin Card' When you play this card you call out a color of your choice. All other players draw cards from the DRAW pile until each draws a card of that color. All of the cards that they draw are added to the cards in their hands.

29758.name: Hustler's The Great American  Baseball Game
29758.description: A solidly made tin Baseball Game that has a large roller at the top and a very nice graphic representation of a ball field. That roller has a slot at the top of the game that shows results of the at bat depending on what is happening on the field. In other words with runners on 1st and 3rd the results might show a Sacrifice Fly while with nobody on base the results might be a Single.

29759.name: Wir fliegen gegen Engeland
29759.description: Boardgame with 6 lead figs 3 U-boots 3 planes, rules in German. Title of the game includes the mis-spelled "Engeland"

29760.name: Flip-O-Hoy
29760.description: extrapolation from 'Play The Game" by Brian Love. Flip-O-Hoy is an aerial race game. It consists of a sky rack divided into stages representing an actual flight. Players advance around the board by spinning the propeller spinner. Different space on the board cause things to happen. Engine Trouble, Air Pockets, Loop the Loop, Fog, Spinning Nose Dive, Forced Landing, and Glide Home either help or hinder your flight.

29761.name: QUAD: Galactic Chess
29761.description:
A chess variant from 2 or 4 players.
Played on a concentric board which allows for "orbiting" movements in addition to the traditional ones.
The aim of the game is to reach the center of the board with the Federation Ship (i.e. the King).

Pieces are named Starfighters, Invaders, Voyagers, Rockets and Shuttles.

Contents
1 board
64 playing pieces;
- 4 Federation ships
- 4 Star Fighters
- 8 Invaders
- 8 Voyagers
- 8 rockets
- 32 shuttles
1 rules booklet

29762.name: The President
29762.description:
THE PRESIDENT GAME
Super Fun - Super Fashion
When you are not playing it - wear it - it's hot!
(65 % polyester, 35% cotton)

Unfold the game and find the playing surface on the back of a fabulous oversized t-shirt (one size only).

Become the Ultimate Power!
Become THE PRESIDENT!

Players must work their way up 7 levels to finally become THE PRESIDENT but beware of the pitfalls and temptations along the way. Don't get caught committing fraud or end up in a sex scandal. Watch out for assassins!

Chose a running mate or go it alone.
Good luck candidates - you are going to need it.
It's not easy being THE PRESIDENT.
Everyone wants the shirt off your back!!

29763.name: Race Around the Clock Elapsed Time Game
29763.description: Build confidence in solving elapsed time problems with this self-checking game featuring real-life elapsed time scenarios. The first player to advance around the clock face game board wins!

29764.name: Primero
29764.description:
Primero (Primiera) is an Italian, renaissance-era card game that spread across Europe in the 16th century, becoming favored in the Elizabethan court. It is hand-based wagering game, not too dissimilar to Poker. Like poker, the goal is to have the highest-ranked hand after several rounds of wagering, although the exact rules differed among numerous regional variants (this too, is much like poker). The game is played with a standard deck, with the 8's, 9's, and 10's removed.

From lowest to highest, the four-card Primero hands are as follows:
- Numerus: Two or three cards of any suit. Only the cards from the strongest suit are scored.
- Primero: One card from each suit.
- Supremus: Ace, 6, 7, of one suit (this is the highest-scoring Numerus, but counts as a superior hand).
- Fluxus: Four cards all of the same suit.
- Chorus: Four of a kind.

Some variations exclude the Supremus or Chorus. Ties are resolved by the total value of the scored cards in the hand.

29765.name: Generationen
29765.description:
"Generations" premiered at Essen 2000. A party game, its publisher describes it as follows:

Are eating breakfast for hours, wearing large earrings, constant noshing, brown from the tanning booths, hanging out at taverns, or sex in the dark typical of golden oldies, cool teens or busy midlifers?

Over 200 statements, situations and behaviors about the generations demand your vote. What do the generations dream about? Who are their models and idols? Over 100 possible life-styles, desires and trends are available for your personal selection.

29766.name: Software Process Improvement Game
29766.description: Also known as SPIG, developed at Carnegie Mellon University as a means of instructing good engineering practices in software design. Said to be Monopoly-like.

29767.name: Admiralty
29767.description:
Admiralty is a set of Wargame rules for fighting under sail for the period 1750 - 1815.

It is a rules-set ( 20+ pages ) and does not contain any figures. It's design in relatively simple and designed to allow players field large forces and still maintain realism in their simulations.

29768.description:
Fantasy II is not an independent game, but an extension for Fantasy

In the kingdom of the forestcreatures, nothing will be the same again. Indeed, the small people of the forest see their universe upset by the arrival of 3 new factions: the Ogres, the Garous, but especially - and it is the worst - the Men whose arrival will move the precarious balance of the fairy-like people. Each new faction has special abilities which will upset the world of Fantasy.

Fantasy II functions according to same principles as the basic game, but with new mechanisms and abilities added to make the play more tactical. As always, it is he that gathers together the most cards in front of him will win the game… And will become chief of the secret forestpeople.

Expands:

Fantasy





Fantasy II n’est pas un jeu indépendant, mais bel et bien une extension pour Fantasy!

Au royaume des créatures de la forêt, rien ne sera plus comme avant. En effet, le petit peuple de la forêt voit son univers chamboulé par l’arrivée de 3 nouvelles factions : les Ogres, les Garous, mais surtout – et c’est le pire – les Hommes qui arrivent à point nommé pour chambouler l’équilibre précaire des peuples féeriques. Chacun dispose de pouvoirs spéciaux qui viennent bouleverser les données de Fantasy.

Fantasy II fonctionne selon les mêmes principes que le jeu de base, mais de nouveaux mécanismes et pouvoirs ont été ajoutés pour rendre le jeu plus tactique. Comme toujours, c'est celui qui réuni le plus de cartes de peuples devant lui gagne la partie… Et devient chef du bois touffu et discret.

Augmente

Fantasy
29768.name: Fantasy II

29769.name: Real Soccer
29769.description:
This Swedish table soccer game claims to be the only soccer simulating game in the world where players are freely moving. The secret is a Swedish patent that allows a player and the metallic stick, that is used to move the figure under the "grass", to have a magnetic connection that is not disturbed by other sticks or figures. Open/closed 106 x 49,5cm x 6,1cm / 54,5 x 49,5 x 12,2cm, weighs 3,9 kg.

There are five players per side, one goalkeeper, two defenders and two attackers. The goalkeeper and the two defenders can only move on one half of the gaming surface and the attackers on the other half.

This game is similar to Real Hockey

29770.name: Thlink
29770.description:
Thlink is the family game of linking by lateral thinking for 2-6 players. Imagination is the key because in this game there are no set answers - it is up to you to link as many of the 16 dealt picture cards to ghe given category as you can. - Taken from the rule book

Thlink is a family friendly party game in which players bid on a the number of "links" they can make between 16 picture cards and 1 category card. Other players have the right to challenge a link and voting determines the outcome.

29771.name: Take a Wild Guess
29771.description:
Take a Wild Guess is an interactive trivia game. It consist of 1,050 trivial questions requiring a number for an answer. The questions are difficult enough so that no one is expected to know the correct answer, but everyone is required to “take a wild guess”. The person reading the question competes against the other players, who work together to arrive at a consensus answer. The interaction between the other players generates conversation and laughter and often a reasonably close guess. Points are awarded to those that are closest to the exact answer and to any answer that falls on or within the “margin of correctness” (50% either side of the exact answer).

There are five categories animals, 19th century America, science, military, and the 21st century.

Sample Question:
During the last Ice Age's coldest stage (approximately 18,000 years ago), the average temperature in what is now Kansas was how may degrees Fahrenheit colder than today?

The correct answer is 18 degrees.

If the reader was closer than the consensus answer of his opponents he receives 1 point for each player. If the consensus answer was closer each player, except the reader, receives 1 point.

Bonus points are awarded if the closest answer falls within the specified margin of correctness. For this question the margin of correctness is 9 degrees to 27 degrees.

29772.name: Creature Feature
29772.description:
Players choose a card representing their monster's body. Each such monster's body can then hold a variable number of heads, limbs and tails (i.e. the blob cannot have a head but can have up to 8 limbs and tails). Each body also provides a special power different from other monsters. Players bid for different cards of body parts, each provides additional powers for your monster.

Players start with 12 dice to allocate among their monster's body parts. The dice indicate the amount of power available to each body part and how much damage it can take.

On each player's turn they can choose to attack with one of their body parts (i.e. laser beams from the head, pincer claw limbs, etc.) rolling the dice from that body part. The player targets an enemy monster's body part, hits cause damage that remove dice from that body part. When a body part runs out of dice it is destroyed. When a monster loses all of its dice it is destroyed. Different powers allow players to reallocate dice and recover dice.

boardgamehonor.8765: 2008 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee

29773.description:
The push-your-luck game Cheeky Monkey includes eight sets of animals – three elephants, four seals, and so on up to ten monkeys – with a plastic chip representing each animal. To start the game, you place all the chips in a bag.

On a turn, a player may draw chips until either (1) he chooses to stop or (2) he draws an animal that he has lying in front of him from a previous draw this turn. In this latter case, he returns all chips in front of him from the current turn to the bag, and the next player then takes his turn. In the former case, he stacks the chips in whatever order he wants on top of any chips he's collected in previous turns. (If a player has animals of only a single type, he can tuck them on the bottom of his stack.) Two special rules come into play while the player draws chips:


If a player draws an animal chip that matches the animal on top of an opponent's stack, the player can steal this animal, adding it to the chips currently in front of him. (If he busts for drawing a duplicate animal, this stolen chip is also returned to the bag.)
If a player draws a monkey, he can either keep the monkey (as with any other animal) or he can swap the monkey for the chip on top of an opponent's stack.


When the last chip has been added to a stack, the game ends. Any player who has more chips of an animal type than any other player receives bonus points equal to the total number of that animal in the game. The player with the most points wins.
29773.name: Cheeky Monkey

29774.name: Poker d'Enfer
29774.description:
The game is not a variant of poker but a game on his own.
Bet with your tokens or with one of your cards representing various goods: a whisky bottle, act of property, alliance,...
But these will have effects on the game.

29775.name: Cranium Grab & Go Connect-O-Round
29775.description:
From the publisher:

The classic four-in-a-row game with a twist
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel
Laugh-out-loud fun for kids -- and adults!
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones
Up and down? Across? Diagonally? Careful -- your opponent already has 3 tokens lined up! Block them, get four in a row, and ta-da -- you win!


Components:
Includes one Connect-O-Round game tube and 42 tokens (21 of each color).

29776.name: Cranium Grab & Go Mega Marbles
29776.description:
This game from the Cranium Grab & Go series takes marbles to a new level. Besides allowing regular play, this game also includes rings that, when the marbles land inside, the player must perform to score points.

From the publisher:

The game of marbles with fun Cranium twists
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel
Fun for kids -- and adults!
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends

Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Mega Marbles!

Play the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists, like shooting marbles into activity rings to determine whether you'll hum, spell, or act out a clue.

What's in the box?
Mega Marbles includes 22 colorful marbles (20 small and 2 large) and 10 goals.

29777.name: Cranium Grab & Go Turbo Tic Tac Toe
29777.description: A version of tic tac toe from Cranium. Their rules allow for many variations on the traditional gameplay, such as dice roles, and flipping and swapping pieces. Part of the Cranium Grab & Go series.

29778.name: Cranium Squawkbox: Bug Hunt
29778.description:
From the Manufacturer
Race to build jitterbugs with this unique electronic talking card game! It's your turn to play Bug Hunt! Can you match pieces to build a bug? Quick -- before time runs out -- and don't forget the tail! Race against family and friends to build jitterbugs -- the first person to get four in their collection wins! Cranium Bug Hunt is portable, easy to play, and features an electronic Bug Hunter as the announcer -- it's a card game unlike any you've played before.

29779.description:
An expansion for Zooloretto, available as a free download from the Spiele aus Timbuktu website.

Each player receives a petting zoo board where they can place offspring to generate money.
29779.name: Zooloretto: The Petting Zoo

29780.name: Pizza Fraction Fun Jr.
29780.description: A creative way to "deliver" an understanding of fractions! Seven games offer different levels for learning the values of: 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, 1/5, 1/6, 1/8, 1/10 and 1/12. Children practice identifying fractions, matching fraction equivalents and adding and subtracting fractions. Game includes 11 double-sided pizzas (one side is labeled with the fraction) with 59 individual slices, three double-sided spinners and game guide.

29781.name: Animals on the Loose: A Beginning Phonics Game for ELLs
29781.description: Help beginning-level ELLs build confidence with this appealing animal-themed phonics game. Pictures encourage home language connection as students learn to decode English words. Game questions focus on word beginnings and endings, letter-sound correspondence, rhyming/word families, letter recognition and spelling. The first player to spell his or her word wins. Game includes 209 cards, die, 4 animal game pieces and Activity Guide. Ages 5 - 7

29783.name: Tschuk
29783.description:
The game consists of 21 coins in a bag (7 additional coins are used as positional markers).

Each coin bears two numbers ranging from 1 to 7 - one number per side. The two numbers are always different.

The coins are thrown on the table and then sorted by the visible numbers.

In his turn a player selects a coin, put it on his side of the table and flips it over.

The first player to reveal all seven numbers on his side of the table wins the game.

Since each coin bears exactly one of the (21) possible combinations of two different numbers from 1 to 7 the players gain more and more information about the numbers still hidden and thus are able to make - quite educated - guesses to select the correct coins.

Online Play


Edition Erlkönig Online Games (solitaire and versus computer opponent)

29784.name: Endless Monsters Upon Japan!
29784.description:
From the website:

" In Endless Monsters Upon Japan! you direct an unstoppable stream of monsters from your home city towards either Tokyo or Hiroshima. One player seeks to reduce the major cities of northern Japan to rubble; the other is against southern Japan.

The monsters are very active, and cause little trouble if allowed to run from city to city. But if delayed at a city they stomp about in frustration and cause great damage. True to the ideals of collectible monster games, the monsters enjoy fighting each other and grow in size with each victory. Moreover, the theme of collectible monster games also led the mad scientists to create three colors of monsters, each of which has an advantage against another.

The game is easy to learn and quick to play. Two playing boards are included: a chart makes learning the game simpler, while a map of Japan is prettier to use. There are numerous strategies, some of which will be discovered quickly by an adult player and others of which are more subtle."

29785.name: Wizards of the Vicious Circle
29785.description:
From the website:

"Wizards of the Vicious Circle is a two-player game as clever and original as any you will see. Strategy goes beyond moving pieces as players try to out-guess which three of five creatures the opponent will initially deploy, and where. The other two creatures become reinforcements later in the game. The vicious circle (how each of the five pieces can capture only one of the opponent's) interacts with board terrain and initial deployments to make each game uniquely interesting and intriguing."

29786.name: IQ Disc
29786.description:
(From the box):
1. Each player takes a turn to throw the dice
2. Stack a disc accordingly on top of the playing stack.
e.g. if a number "2" is thrown, place a disc with its hole over the 2 of the disc on the top of the stack.
3. The player who topples the stack loses.

Contents: 15 Discs and 1 die.

29788.name: Walls and Stairways
29788.description:
From the website:

"An underground magical labyrinth has several stairway exits, each climbing up to the surface and ending beside a city. The players represent these cities. The goal is to have heroes/heroines exit the labyrinth to your city -- and the more treasure such heroes/heroines carry the better!"

29789.name: Catch 19
29789.description:
36 balls are evenly distributed into 12 tubes. On your turn, empty a tube and place the balls in the next tubes, one each, going anti-clockwise. If you place a ball in an empty tube on your side you capture that ball and all the balls in your opponent's adjacent tubes.

The winner is the first to capture 19 balls, as there are 36 to start with.

It's a 3D game related to Mancala, but very different in physical style.

29790.name: Alien Checkers
29790.description:
From the website:

"Alien Checkers is a versatile game. Besides using cards during the game, players select one of nine special cards to secretly find out which planet they are representing: each planet has a different secret victory condition. Children can enjoy how the game is silly and (compared to plain checkers) gives them a better chance of winning when playing their parents. Adults who wish to analyze the game more carefully will notice new flavors of strategy as the cards and secret goals work together."

29791.name: Chessboard Heroism
29791.description:
From the website:

"In Chessboard Heroism you are a hero or heroine, trying to do heroic things before wars break out and your career options are reduced to boring military service. You long to solve real quests: saving people who need rescuing, finding lost magical items, fighting wild monsters, etc. But time is running out! Cards detailing quests cover a chessboard's squares. Solve the quests faster than your opponents while cooperatively maintaining the political stalemate or the game ends! And watch out for the randomly wandering dragon!"

29792.name: Markets and Mercenaries
29792.description:
From the publisher:

" Markets and Mercenaries is a simple and quick board game that combines the interesting features of many more primitive "build a colony" computer and board games (resources, buildings, market economics, special events) while excluding features that tend to slow such a game down (exploration, territorial expansion, conquest). The game uses a Monopoly-like path around the board's outer edge allow random events in a way that carefully prohibits luck from overriding strategy.

Players use wise resource management and strategic construction of new buildings to expand their colony. Resources are not only traded among players but bought and sold with the Empire in a market with varying (and manipulatable) prices. The colonies also build up military strength to use at the conclusion of the game when the colonies jointly declare independence and the Empire responds with an invading army. "

boardgameimplementation.184537: ATS Spanish Blue Division: Eastern Front 1941

29793.description: Using the Advanced Tobruk System, this installment depicts the efforts of the 250th Infantry "Blue" Division, made up of Spaniards sympathetic to the Nazi cause. Specifically, the scenarios here deal with small-unit actions around the area of the Volkhov River in northwest Russia.
29793.name: ATS: Axis Legion – Spanish Division Azul on the Eastern Front

29794.name: Gnome Crystals
29794.description:
The game uses a 6x6 grid as the main playing area. Each player receives a bunch of little plastic pieces and 2 large ones (gnome crystals) with an irregular shape.

The object is to score the most points by the time the game ends, which happens immediately when someone runs out of pieces to play. A point is scored by having a straight or diagonal arrangement of three crystals of the same color, and a large crystal as part of such an arrangement scores 2 points instead of 1. A line of 4 crystals scores twice, once for each "end" of the row.

The game is played by rolling two dice, one for each side of the grid (rows and columns). After rolling the dice, the player places them on the appropriate row and column that matches the die face. Then the player can place a crystal in any empty location on either the row or column indicated. They can also choose to "combat" another player's crystal on the specific intersection of the rolled dice. Combat involves a simple die-off, defender wins ties, with a large crystal providing a +1 bonus to the roll.

Finally, if a player rolls doubles and is able to place a crystal on the intersection (say row 3 and column 3), then they get to roll again.

29795.description:
The usual Uno (including themed editions without new cards) rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

Based on the TV show The Simpson's Halloween Specials Treehouse of Horror.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Witchcraft Card - Can be played to counter a Draw 2 or Draw 4 card. Can also be used as a wild card.
29795.name: UNO: The Simpsons Treehouse of Horror

29796.description: Rush is a territory game played with a Go set. Players take turns adding their own stones. Players cannot add a stone which is horizontally adjacent to two or more stones, if all of the connecting stones are the same color as the added stone. If a player adds a stone which forms two or more connections, he must add another stone during his turn, and keep adding stones during his turn until his most recent stone connects to one or less stones, concluding his turn. The object is to have the majority of stones on the board when the board fills up.
29796.name: Rush

29797.name: Swizzle
29797.description:
From the game manual:
Swizzle is an easy to learn but challenging strategy game. Players try to get their chips three-in-a-line. Both players play cards and swizzles to determine where the chips will be played. Be prepared for the fun of unexpected endings in this fascinating game.

29798.name: UNO: National Football League NFC Edition
29798.description:
The usual Uno rules - Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color or number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw cards from the draw pile until they are able to place a card. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit. Additionally, when playing their penultimate card from their hand, players must shout 'UNO' or face a forfeit of drawing two further cards.

These two football themed editions of UNO feature pictures of AFC and NFC stars on the cards.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: 'Champs Card' - When this card is played, the player who plays it selects another player to draw cards. That player must draw until he has drawn a number 4 card or seven cards total. The player playing the 'Champs Card' also selects the new color of play.

29799.name: Super Model
29799.description:
A Brazilian Game designed to Top Models wanna be. Translation from the box:

"Super Model: The Top Models Game
The life of a Top Model is full of glamour, dreams and fantasy... sometimes, it even resembles a fairytale. The Super Model game shows a little of the backstage of this very exclusive world, in a very god way, relaxed, super-fun and with a lot of charm. You will feel how is to be a real top and make lots, lots of money and will discover some hints that can help you to "Get It" in the real life! Besides all of this, the game is recommended by Ana Hickmann, one of the Brazil and World's most famous Top Models."

It shows a model life in three stages, each different from the previous, and the objective is to be the richest model after a month being a Top Model.

29800.name: Le'Tour Colorado
29800.description:
Enjoy the experience of touring through one of the most scenic and exciting states in the nation, learning interesting facts about prominent people, places, sports and recreation along the way. You can impress your friends and family with what you already know. When you finish Le'Tour, you will be an expert on Colorado. We might even call you a native.

Le'Tour is designed for 2 to 40 players. It is well suited to be a team game with up to four teams of players.

29801.name: Chassepot and Needlegun

4676.name: And That's The Way It Was...

29801.description: Chassepot and Needlegun is a set of wargames rules for fighting battles of the Franco - Prussian War in miniature. The standard units are the infantry battalion, cavalry regiment and artillery battery. The rules also include supplemental material for the Crimean War, Franco - Austrian War, Austro - Prussian War, and the Mexican War.

29802.name: Twisted Pairs
29802.description:
* The letter-acting pair spin the spinner to select a phrase category, and select a card from either the pre-1990s or post-1990s card set.
* The two letter actors move their bodies together to shape each letter individually to spell out the entire phrase.
* All other players secretly guess each letter being acted, and write the letters on their word sheets.
* When the first player in the audience correctly guesses the entire phrase being spelled, he or she yells it out.
* The first player to guess the phrase correctly wins a point; the two letter-acting players win points.
* Bonus points are earned for being the first player to yell out the bonus answer on the back of the card:
o the name of the actor who played the famous character
o the name of the character who said the famous quote
o the artist of the song title
o the title of the song the song lyric is from
* The first player to score 10 points wins .
* The Trivia Question category has a little twist - the letter-acting players must spell out the answer to the trivia question without discussing what the answer is! There is no bonus point for the Trivia Question category.

29803.name: Bark Future
29803.description:
Bark Future - Where Dogs Rule and Humans Drool.

The game is set in post-apocalypse USA. The majority of the Earth’s surface has been destroyed in a nuclear holocaust and mankind was largely wiped out. In their place has stepped the mutated canines who now rule the world. They are picking out a future from the dustbins of history.

Published in Games Review Monthly, June 1989, Issue 9.

29804.name: Escape From Amarth Bara
29804.description: For one thousand years, the home of the evil sorcerer Ardune, Amarth Bara, has been deserted until recently. Now monsters started to emerge and attack the kingdom. It only seems that Ardune has risen once more. Only 6 of the bravest knights have been summoned to investigate. All 6 entered the doors, but they never returned. All was fuzzy in their minds as they woke to find themselves lost in an endless dungeon. Now they must fight their way out and Escape from Amarth Bara

boardgameimplementation.143403: Petits meurtres & faits divers: au tribunal

boardgamehonor.20328: 2008 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee

29805.description: The inspector is trying to find out the murderer by doing several interrogations. Each player has one minute to explain why he isn't the murderer. He must say three words that are written in his book - all the innocents have the same three words they MUST use, but the murderer has three different words. The murderer is trying to pose as innocent by finding and using their three words, while the innocent players are trying to use the murderer's words to appear guilty.
29805.name: Petits Meurtres & Faits Divers

29806.name: Hallo, Taxi!
29806.description:
The boards shows a tangle of streets and 40 specially marked points on these streets, which correspond to the 40-card order deck that is used for play. Besides that order deck, there is also a 12-card deck with 4 different penalty cards.

When a player has drawn an order, he must try to reach the end point within a certain number a turns, which is determined by the throw of a die. The shortest distance to the end point is the amount of chips that can be won, but failing to succeed results in loosing further turns as well as loosing chips.

Before throwing the die, each player must choose among 4 risk levels: the higher the level, the farther can his move go, but the higher is also the risk to be punished with a penalty card.

The game ends after a previously fixed amount of time and the player with the most chips is the winner.

34085.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Battle Pack Alpha

29807.description:
Lock ‘n Load: Not One Step Back is Lock ‘n Load’s first foray into the Eastern Front of World War II. This expansion includes the units, rules, and scenarios that gamers need to recreate the desperate struggles on the Russian steppe, ruins of Stalingrad, and partisan-infested woodlands.

Command Soviet heavy tanks, such as the KV-1, SU-152, and JS-2. Brew up hapless T34 tanks with your incredible King Tiger. Use the Soviet Guards to lead counterattacks in the city, and the new German Pioneers to retake lost ground. Ambush German convoys with Partisans and whip cowards back into line with Commissars.

The game’s armor includes T-34/76, T-70 T-34/85, JS-2, KV-1, SU-76, SU-85, SU-152, King Tigers,A Soviet 76mm ATG prepares to take on a German King Tiger German Halftracks, and Sd 222 armored cars. Infantry additions consist of Guards (two flavors), Line Soviets (again, two types), Partisans, Commissars, Nurses, veteran German infantry, German Pioneers, Molotov Cocktails, DP-28, 45mm and 76mm Anti-tank guns, 82mm mortars, and 12.7mm machine guns.

The hex halos have been seriously tuned down. 255 die cut counters and three, mounted geomorphic mapboards.

Not One Step Back is not a complete game. This is an expansion and requires both Band of Heroes and Swift & Bold to play all twelve of its scenarios. Most, however, of the missions can be played with just Not One Step Back and Band of Heroes.

Expands:

Lock 'n Load: Band of Heroes
Lock 'n Load: Swift and Bold
29807.name: Lock 'n Load: Not One Step Back

29808.name: Monster Liner
29808.description:
A luxury liner hits an iceberg and begins to sink. Unfortunately, some of the world's great monsters that had been captured and placed in this boat as part of the liner's entertainment - a giant ape, a vampire, a fish-man, a wolf-man, a mummy and a man-monster - roam free now that their cages have been broken. It's up to the stalwart heroes who captured these creatures the first time, to take them down permanently. And they have to do it amongst, fleeing passengers, unsuspecting maidens and frantic crew. Oh, and before this ship sinks.

This game was the winner of a "Monster-Themed Design Contest" that Z-Man Games held on the Board Game Designer's Forum.

boardgameimplementation.188692: Battles of the English Civil Wars 1642 - 1651 Volume I

boardgamecompilation.188692: Battles of the English Civil Wars 1642 - 1651 Volume I

29809.description:
Twin of Edgehill, this one is a game on the last battle of the English Civil War fought by King Charles I before his capture and beheading. It shares with its twin brother the same gaming system and the same astonishing graphics for the map and counters art and it makes for another fast and challenging head to head game, with two armies of almost the same capabilities and strengths, that is very fun to play also solitaire in less than an hour.

Contains:
11 x 17" full color map (2 - 8.5 x 11" parts)
120 full color counters

Print-n-Play version available at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=551
29809.name: Naseby: The End of a Reign

29810.name: Chronology: Sports Edition

boardgameversion.60927: Great American Puzzle Factory first US edition

29810.description:
Chronology - Sports Edition: A Card Game for All Time

Players build a time line of cards. Each card contains a sports event and the year in which it occurred. Players begin with one card each, which is placed face up in front of them. On her turn, a player is read an event from a new card; the player must then indicate the position on her own time line where the card should be placed. If she's correct she places the card in her own time line; if not, the next player gets an opportunity to win the card. The first player with ten cards wins.

The cards from this edition may be mixed with the original Chronology game to create even more combinations.

29811.name: One Bad Apple
29811.description:
In this children's dexterity game, you must pick an apple from the barrel on your turn. You can either try for the big red one that's worth the most points, or try a smaller one that may be easier to pick.

Reach for the stem and lift the apple up, but be careful! If you pick it without disturbing any other apples, you get to keep it and score points. But if the apple you pick makes the wormy apple pop up it goes back into the barrel and you lose points on that turn. Then reset the game for continued play.

29812.name: Fun at the Zoo Game
29812.description:
Fun at the Zoo is a children's game. From the side of the box:

Players choose the colored marker they wish to play and place it at the ZOO entrance. To determine playing turns, players spin the spinner one time and the player with the highest number begins first, and the other players follow in turn to the left. Shuffle the Suspense Cards and place face down in the center of the playing board.

Players spin the spinner and move forward the amount of spaces indicated on the spinner dial. At "Your Zoo" you may "Feed" some of your Zoo friends and some you may not. Upon landing on a space marked for one of your Zoo Friends, player draws one of the Suspense Cards. If the players marker is on a space marked "You May Feed" and the Suspense Card states to "Feed", player may go ahead 2 spaces. If the turned over card says "Do Not Feed" player must go back 2 spaces. By the same token, if the player marker is on a "Do Not Feed" space and the card turned over says "Do Not Feed" player may go ahead 2 spaces, but if the card says to "Feed" player must go back 2 spaces. Replace the suspense card face down under the pile after use. The first player to arrive back to the entrance wins the game!

29813.name: Employee of the Week
29813.description:
"Play as a sleazy computer salesman in this insanely, chaotic card/ dexterity game of sensory overload."

In Employee of the Week, there are seven working days during which the players must collect the necessary parts to fulfill as many orders as possible.

Employee of the Week is self-published by Toronto-based Steve Lefort (creator of Treasure Quest), and can be played at various Toronto Area Boardgaming Society (www.tabsonline.net) gatherings.

Employee of the Week is currently slated for a 4th Quarter 2007 release.

29814.name: Xombies Attack!!!
29814.description:
Following on the heels of his extremely popular Treasure Quest, Steve Lefort brings you Xombies Attack!!!

Xombies Attack!!! is a whole new zombie experience, finally bringing you the look and feel of a classic Romero film that fits on your dining room table!

Terrain Note The terrain shown in these photos is from WorldWorksGames "Urban Mayhem"
product line. (Please note that ANY terrain will suffice for this game and this is NOT an endorsement of the WorldWorksGames Products)

In this grid based miniatures game, Xombies have overrun the city, lusting for flesh. Four very different squads must work their way through the city, fighting off hordes of Xombies while trying to reach their individual objectives. Search buildings, rescue panicked civilians, find weapons and items while avoiding nuclear obliteration. Quick paced tactics will award you victory! Recklessness will infect you with the bloodlust of the undead...

"Xombies Attack!!!" is currently under development and is slated for a 4th Quarter 2007 release.

29815.name: Renaissance Raiders
29815.description: Card driven, hex based miniatures rules for Border Reivers and the Wars of Religion. The rules area event cards and combat is resolved either by traditional six sided dice or by using the sticker templates provided to create a set of special dice.

29816.name: Texas Renaissance Festival Game
29816.description: The object of the game is to be the first to enter the Royal Castle by winning a series of contests and challenges.

29817.name: Dynamiki
29817.description:
Two states have declared war against each other. You are appointed the Supreme Commander of one of the states. Your forces: two armored, two mechanized, two airborne and five infantry divisions. How will you save your country?

Age-old strategy and the principles and weapons of modern warfare are brought together in the exciting game of Dynamiki. Based on the ancient Chinese game of Hsiangchi, Dynamiki reflects the concepts of some of history's most brilliant strategists. Match your wits against your opponent's but be prepared: tricks, twists and surprises await you at every turn.

Dynamiki is a modernized version of the age-old Chinese game of Hsiangchi whose original form is believed to be the world's earliest precursor of chess. Historical documents showed that it existed in China as early as 2400 years ago.

The pieces are: the Headquarters (building), the Capital Garrison (guard shack), Periphral Garrison (pillbox), Armored Force (tank), Motorized Infantry (gun jeep), the Airborne (helicopter), and the Infantry (soldier on foot).

Dynamiki also contains two other fast-paced, amusing Chinese games: Anki and Dakitzi, offering you a wide variety of game playing pleasure.

Anki - Combines skill and chance in an exciting and unpredictable contest of elimination.

Dakitzi - Somewhat like poker, but is more flexible and tricky, and moves much more faster.

29818.name: Activity Ruhrpott
29818.description:
This follow-on to Activity (1993) premiered at Essen 2000.

It is a party game for teams with progress being tracked using up to 4 pawns on the board.

One player of a team draws a card showing something from the Ruhr area of Germany. Then, depending on the card type, the player either draws on paper, silently acts out or verbally describes what is displayed on the card so that his teammates can guess it.

A sand timer determines whether the clue was achieved in sufficient time and whether the team's pawn may advance.

Usually lasts about an hour.

29819.name: Peter R. de Vries: Misdaadverslaggever
29819.description:
In this game the players are trying to solve a crime by combining different clues. The trick is which clues to use and which to discard. If you play your cards right you will be able to close the case by connecting all the five facets of the crime: Suspect, Motive, Witness, Crime scene and Traces.

The game is named after the "famous" Dutch crime reporter Peter R. de Vries.

29820.name: Pompeu Fabra i el seu temps
29820.description:
Pompeu Fabra i el seu temps was edited to commemorate the 75th anniversary of the publication of the Diccionari general de la llengua catalana ("Catalan Language General Dictionary") in 1932 by the linguist and Catalan language reformer Pompeu Fabra, who modernized Catalan grammar and orthography. His dictionary is widely considered a milestone in the history of Catalan language, as for the first time modern linguistic ideas were introduced in the grammar.

In the game the players together rebuild Pompeu Fabra's life and works, as well as the various social, cultural and political events that took place during his life: from his birth in Barcelona in 1868 until his death in exile at Prada de Conflent (France) in 1948. Each year in the life of Pompeu Fabra is represented by a card, and the players try to fill in the holes in the chronology, which in the initial setup is formed only by four years. The filling rules are simple and the players receive points each time a grouping of three, six or nine cards is completed.

29821.description:
Taken from the Press Pass Inc. press release:

Press Pass, Inc. [recently] announced a licensing agreement with the Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation for the 24™ TCG (Trading Card Game). Based on the action-packed drama airing every Monday night at 9:00 p.m. (8:00 p.m. Central) on Fox, the 24™ TCG is scheduled to launch in August 2007 and builds on the success established by Press Pass with its critically acclaimed Fullmetal Alchemist TCG.

Currently in its sixth season, 24™ follows the life of CTU agent Jack Bauer (played by Kiefer Sutherland) and his allies, minute by minute, through a single 24-hour day full of heart-stopping action and intense drama as they work to quell a threat to the American people. The Emmy award-winning series boasts nearly 16 million viewers each week and has inspired a wide range of licensed properties, including PlayStation2 video games, novels, comic books, and an upcoming line of action figures.

“This is a license we’re thrilled to get,” said Edward Bolme, TCG Product Manager for Press Pass. “We’re designing this game to capture the essence of action and tension that the show portrays. We think the fans will find it a very exciting and attractive game.”

“Fans of 24™ will love this game,” added Virginia King, Executive Director of Fox Licensing and Merchandising. “Serious collectors who don’t play games will want to collect these cards.”

Created by the award-winning Press Pass, Inc. design team responsible for the Fullmetal Alchemist TCG (voted #1 New TCG of 2005 by readers of Scrye and InQuest and Best Anime TCG of 2006 by Anime Insider), the 24™ TCG will let you play either with or against CTU in a fast-paced struggle for victory. The game will feature 24-card decks and can be played in 15 to 20 minutes. Press Pass will also conduct a comprehensive marketing and promotion campaign as well as an aggressive tournament system.
29821.name: 24 Trading Card Game

29822.name: 'Round the World Joe
29822.description: This game consists of words and phrases that are used to fill in the blanks of Joe's traveling narrative. This game measures 5 3/4" x 4 1/4" x 1".

29823.name: Chippendale's After Hours Game
29823.description: Adult game where players land on spaces and then have to do certain things in order to make money. Take it off, tell a dirty joke, play charades, make a toast, go to the dance floor etc.

29825.name: Occult Wars
29825.description:
Ever fancied gaming "Buffy: The Vampire Slayer", "Underworld" or even "Constantine"?

Occult Wars is a set of miniature wargaming rules that allow you to game in a horror setting, playing as a group of humans hunting horrific monsters.

But that's not all.

You can also play as a group of Vampires, Werewolves, or even Angelic or Demonic Beings. Each faction has it's own abilities and unique weaknesses

The game rules and for 'skirmish' style games, using up to 10 or so miniatures a side. And includes campaign rules for character enhancement between encounters.

Additionally, Occult Wars contains many additions that allow you to play the game as an RPG-Lite style campaign.

29826.description:
"Gemüsereis" (vegetable rice) was included as "Spiel im Heft" (game in the zine) in Spielbox 6/87, where 3 games were published, that could be played with special miniature fruit figures.

This game needs 5 of these figures: 1 tomato, 1 onion, 1 paprika, 1 mushroom and 1 corncob. The first 4 are the normal fruit figures, while the corncob is used to determine the movements.

The board has 4 fruit spaces, 6 cooking pot spaces and 10 movement spaces. Each of the 6 cooking pot spaces shows 4 fields, 2 empty ones and 2 showing one of the 4 normal fruit figures.

Winner of the game is the player who can fill one of the 6 cooking spot with the missing 2 fruits.
29826.name: Gemüsereis

29827.description:
This game is a wargame published by the French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 13 - Feb 1983).
The game covers the Medellin battle (28 march 1809) opposing French and Spanish troops.
29827.name: Medellin

29828.name: Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball
29828.description: Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Gardner's Championship Golf, All Star Basketball, Gardner's Stock Car Race , All Star Football and Verne Gagne Wrestling. Mickey Mantles Big League Baseball is a simple and easy game to play. On each play the team in the field flips a colored die and the team at bat spins a spinner. The color on the die and the number on the spinner determine the results of the play.

29829.name: Verne Gagne Wrestling
29829.description: Verne Gagne Wrestling is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball, All Star Football, Gardner's Championship Golf, All Star Basketball and Gardner's Stock Car Race .

29830.name: All Star Football
29830.description: All Star Football is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball, All Star Basketball, Gardner's Stock Car Race , Gardner's Championship Golf, and Verne Gagne Wrestling.

29831.name: All Star Basketball
29831.description: All Star Basketball is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball , Gardner's Stock Car Race , Gardner's Championship Golf, Verne Gagne Wrestling, and All Star Football

29832.name: Gardner's Stock Car Race
29832.description: Gardner's Stock Car Race is one of 6 games that were included in a grouping of games from the Gardner Company. All games came in the same box under the title of Big 6 Sports Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box with this game was; All Star Football, Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball, Verne Gagne Wrestling, Gardner's Championship Golf, and All Star Basketball.

29833.name: Gardner's Championship Golf
29833.description: Gardner's Championship Golf was one of 6 games that were included in a package of games called Big 6 Sport Games. This is a simple spin and find the results game. Also included in the box were Verne Gagne Wrestling, All Star Football, Mickey Mantle's Big League Baseball, All Star Basketball, Gardner's Stock Car Race .

29834.name: Steve Garvey's Superstar Baseball
29834.description: Steve Garvey's Superstar Baseball is a baseball-themed dice game not a baseball simulation. The game is divided into five parts: hitting ground balls, bunting, hit and run play, base running, and power hitting. In every case, a player takes a turn by rolling the four dice and checking the appropriate table for the results. A player could score one or two points each turn. The player who has more points at the end of the game wins. The game comes with magnetic ball and magnetic players, dice, and instructions.

29835.name: Pirelli
29835.description:
Pirelli is a card game played with a standard deck of 52 cards. Points are scored by having the largest total value in rows, columns, and diagonals on a 5x5 board. Additional bonus points are given by having adjacent cards of the same suit. Play is simultaneous with each player selecting a card from his or her cards. The player with the lower numbered card then places both cards.

This game was the basis for the game FNAP.

29836.description:
The "Kochtopf-Spiel" (=cooking pot game) was included as "Spiel im Heft" (game in the zine) in Spielbox 6/87, where 3 games were published, that could be played with special miniature fruit figures.

This game needs 5 of these fruit figures: 1 tomato, 1 paprika, 1 onion, 1 mushroom and as special figure 1 corncob.

The board shows 5x5 spaces, where five 3x3 areas are specially marked. Each area is reserved for one playing figure, that is each figure can only move within its area.
The four 3x3 areas in the corners are reserved for the 4 normal playing figures, the area in the middle is the corncob's one.

Each player has a set of 8 cards: 4 showing a fruit figure and 4 are numbered from 1-4. These cards are used to move the playing pieces, but a move is always put together from 2 cards from 2 different players!

Object of the game is to move 3 of the 4 normal figures in the centre area and get the corncob to one of the corners of his area. The player who sits nearest to that corner is the winner of the game.
29836.name: Kochtopf-Spiel

29837.name: Flusi
29837.description: Flusi is a simple action game based on a "sock monster" character popularized in childrens' books. The game box doubles as a sock drawer for the game. Players load up sock monsters onto a simple catapult and fling them trying to hit the sock drawer. For each monster than makes it into the drawer, socks are taken. Whoever gets the most socks in a round gets a clothespin. Get two clothespins and win the game! Simple and fun, and kids often do better than the adults.

29838.name: SHA-EE
29838.description: SHA-EE is a path-building game. Players start at the edge of the board and place triangular tiles to extend their paths towards the center space. There are restrictions on when each section of the board can be entered. Some spaces must be occupied by the players' small guard pieces; occupying some of these spaces requires rolling the special die, and occupation of others can be challenged, which also requires rolling the die. The game ends when someone occupies the center space with their king, but the winner of the game is the one who scores the most points from their occupied spaces, not necessarily the player who reaches the center.

boardgamehonor.19995: 2009 Games Magazine Best New Advanced Strategy Game Winner

29839.description:
Key Harvest is the fifth game in the key series of games published by R&D Games.

The object of the game is to score the most points. Players score points by placing tiles on their own country board. One point is scored for each field tile in the player's largest group of connected field tiles and two points for each tile in their second largest connected group.

Points are also scored for the worker tiles a player places on their country board. The number of points scored for each worker is equal to the number on the worker tile. Worker tiles do not count as connecting tiles when calculating the largest group of tiles. When played, a worker enables a player to take a special action. Each player has their own team of six workers, known as farmhands. There are also six townsfolk who can be acquired by any player.

There are usually six field tiles available at any time from the registry. On their turn a player may bid for up to two tiles using crop counters. The field tile being bid for and the bid in crop counters are placed in the player's store. On their turn the other players may match the store owner's bid in both the number and type of crop counters. If they choose to do so, then they place the field tile on their country board and pay the crop counters to the store owner. If no other player has matched the store owner's bid, then on their next turn the store owner may place the field tile(s) from their store onto their country board and pay their bid in crop counters to the general stock.

When deciding how much to bid for a field tile, players will need to consider how important the field tile is to them and whether other players are likely to bid for the tile. It is usually beneficial for a player to place field tiles into their store as that player will either obtain the field tile or receive additional crop counters.

When played, a worker tile must be adjacent to at least the number of field tiles as the number on the worker tile. A worker tile cannot be adjacent to another worker tile. If a player obtains a field tile for a space where they have already placed a worker tile, they must remove the worker tile. However, if the worker tile can be replaced immediately (next to the required number of field tiles), then the player can benefit from the worker's ability again. Getting these extra benefits is one of the keys to doing well in the game.

Players have two actions per turn. There are four possible actions. Each action can only be performed once per turn. As described above, the actions include placing field tiles from the stores onto their country board - action (c), placing field tiles from the registry into their store - action (d), and placing a worker tile onto their country board - action (b). Action (c) cannot be performed after action (d). A player may also harvest crops by turning over some unharvested field tiles on their country board - action (a).

Field tiles taken from the registry are replaced immediately with field tiles from the bag. The bag also contains a number of event tiles. The event tiles, when drawn, affect all of the players, not just the player who drew the event tile. When the tenth event tile is drawn, the game ends after two further rounds have been played.

One point is also awarded to the players who have the most of each of the types of crop counters at the end of the game. No points are awarded for ties. Points are tallied using the scoring track on the town board. The player with the most points is the winner.

Nr. 4 in the QWG Master Print Edition series, as Demetra
29839.name: Key Harvest

29840.name: Tom & Jerry Game
29840.description: This is a spin and move game. Object of the game is to begin in the mouse hole of your color and then by spinning the correct colors leave your hole, find your sweet - whether its cake pie sugar cookies - land on that treat and then get back into your hole in the floor first.

29841.name: 'Bouta Face
29841.description: Bouta Face is a matching-memory card game (It is About Faces). The specialized card deck has 11 different colorful funny and amusing faces. Most card games use one side of the card - Bouta Face uniquely uses both sides on every turn. There are 3 game variations - a beginners version, an advanced version and a solitaire game. All three have the objective of matching as many identical faces in pairs as possible. The person who collects the most pairs wins. The games are easy to learn, and hugely entertaining. Unlike any card game you have ever played. Recommended Ages 7 and up, 2 to 4 players.

29842.name: Terry Tell Time
29842.description:
Game for very young children that helps them tell time. Features a colorful playing board divided into 4 color sections, 24 Terry Tell Time Activity Cards (4 each of 6 different scenes), and 1 Clock N' Color Spinner.

Based on the TV show "The Adventures of Terry Tell Time", featuring Carol Reed and the Bunin Puppets. Captain Terry (seen on the game box) and his sister Tina Tell Time (both from Switzerland) were the puppets that helped children learn to tell time. The 1950's kids show also featured cartoons, music and more.

29843.name: The Merry Bell Game
29843.description: A friendly little game for 2, 3 or 4 young children. The object of The Merry Bell Game is to be the first to move from Start to Finish, following the colorful dots on the gameboard. Players ring their bells when they spin their color and when they land on a picture space.

29844.description:
The Battle for the Reichstag, April 28th-May 1st 1945

Including a revised map with larger hexes, and all errata included, this version of Heat of Battle's Historical ASL module details 10 historical scenarios and full campaign rules for the Soviet assault on Berlin.

Also included is a small sheet of 56 counters, including Gestapo Leaders, dug in tanks (treated as pillboxes - including King Tigers!) and numerous others.

Oh, and Hitler.

The game requires the ASL rules, Beyond Valor, Yanks, Kampfgruppe Peiper II, and also references Red Barricades.

Expands:

Advanced Squad Leader
Beyond Valor: ASL Module 1
Yanks: ASL Module 3
Kampfgruppe Peiper II: ASL Historical Module 3
Red Barricades: ASL Historical Module 1




(all are required for expansion play)
29844.name: Berlin: Red Vengeance

29846.name: Fire Chief
29846.description: The Fire Chief Board Game comes from See Right Games and was produced in 1957. A game where players try to protect the local neighborhood from fires by walking on the paths throughout the neighborhood using a spinner and then encountering problems using another spinner. Whoever does best at protecting the neighborhood wins the game.

29847.description:
An expansion for the Advanced Tobruk System game on the Battle of the Bulge, Darkest December, depicting the fighting between US and German forces in the Baraque de Fraiture area in Belgium, December 1944. Contains several new scenarios, a selection of new counters and a new map based on Pedro Ramis' on-the-ground research.

Ownership of DARKEST DECEMBER or German Personnel, US Personnel, US AFVs, German AFVs, and the LATE WAR GERMAN AND AMERICAN AFVS sheet (DD_1) is needed to use this expansion.

Expands:

Advanced Tobruk
29847.name: ATS: Parker's Crossroads

29848.description:
Battle for Baghdad is a unique multi-player game in which players represent different factions vying for control of the governance of Iraq during US occupation. The game emphasizes the roles and capabilities of the various factions involved, and demonstrates how asymmetric capabilities can be leveraged to generate favorable outcomes.

The playing surface is constructed from satellite images of the city of Baghdad and each component is carefully researched for authenticity. For three to seven players, the board game is of moderate complexity.

Complexity: 3 (1 to 10)
Playing Time: 1 to 2 Hours

Components:
• 280 Die-cut Counters
• 30 Command Cards
• 35 Arab Street Cards
• 63 Arms Bizaar Cards
• Full-Color 22x22 Inch Mounted Map
• Two 20-Sided Dice
• Six Faction Displays
• Rules & Notes Book
• Strategy Guide
29848.name: Battle for Baghdad

29849.name: Word Factory
29849.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Word Factory is a non-authorized version of Big Boggle.




From the publisher:
A mind-boggling word game guaranteed to make a player eat words, think words, dream words in just a few games.

Players shake up 25 letter cubes and make words out of adjoining letters. As fast as he can, a player searches for words that he hopes his opponents won't find.

29850.name: Gruff Goats
29850.description:
From the website:

" In Goats Gruff you are a fairy in charge of guiding your goats (big, medium, and little) to the Island of Good Grass. There are four bridges from the Outside Land to the Island. Two trolls move among these four bridges. Play cards to take and use the magic wands: if you have the proper magic wand you can move a certain-sized goat or a troll. Also, if you have just the right combinations of cards you can stir the dragon, who will swoop down to eat one of your rival's goats. Who will be the first to help three goats get to the Island?

This is a children's game because strategy can be neglected for straightforward play and the way in which players compete for the magic wands is childishly simple (I'm taking it... No you're not... Yes I am... No you're not...). Adults would probably enjoy this game as much as children only when tired or inebriated. For a more mature, intellectual, similar game based on the same game mechanic please see my Walls and Stairways. "

Available at http://davidvs.net/boardgames/

29851.name: An Artifact for Dr. Storn?
29851.description:
From the website:

"An Artifact for Dr. Storn? blends diplomacy and board-movement in an original way, creating an interstellar treasure hunt that appeals to both a childlike desire to collect nifty artifacts and a mature desire for strategy. Players are agents sent by different planetary governments to collect famous artifacts. Since some artifacts cannot be picked up unless you are carrying others, players constantly trade and steal artifacts. How should you balance trading for mutual benefit with hindering your opponents' progress? How can you time your interplanetary travel so you are carrying or steal the artifacts you need the moment you return to your home world? Should you abandon your main quest and search for the mysterious Book of Knowledge, that if correctly handled will allow a second player to claim victory?"

29852.name: Thought Eaters
29852.description:
From the website:

"Thought Eaters is a quick, cute maze game. Each player is attempting to navigate a path to the center of the board. If all goes well this path involves seven turns. Players draw and play two "turn right" or "turn left" tiles each turn to represent their animal's own planning. Each turn players also can move one tile anywhere on the board. If your plan is good enough your animal moves along its path of tiles. You will need strategy and diplomacy to reach the goal first."

boardgamecompilation.169521: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansions #2 and #3 – Rome vs the Barbarians; The Roman Civil Wars

29853.description:
The Roman Civil Wars will feature familiar units with new capabilities. The Roman legions have evolved into the deadly fighting units of legend. In terms of Commands and Colors performance, the medium infantry units (representing less experienced legions) and heavy infantry units (representing the veteran legions) will now be able to move two hexes without engaging in close combat, or still move one hex and have close combat (as well as throwing their pilum - a capability acquired in Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #2 – Rome and the Barbarians). You will be able to fight battles with medium and heavy infantry as you have never fought them before!

Rules-wise, if you've played Commands & Colors: Ancients, you'll have no trouble at all learning the few special rules for these legionary infantry units, for the basic mechanics remain unchanged. The battle dice resolve combat quickly and the Command cards provide an element of luck that creates a fog of war and presents players with both challenges and opportunities for victory. Yet the tactics you need to execute conform remarkably well to the advantages and limitations inherent to the various Ancient units, their weapons, terrain and the history.

But that's not all... GMT is also going to include another mounted mapboard in Expansion #3, configured to be mated to the mounted board from Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #2 – Rome and the Barbarians. In addition the Commands & Colors: Epic Ancients new Command rules for fighting large-scale historical battles will provide those of you interested in fighting truly large-scale, multi-player, ancient battles the perfect and unique opportunity to do so with a number of your friends.

Expands:

Commands & Colors: Ancients
29853.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #3 – The Roman Civil Wars

29854.name: Critical Acclaim: The Acting Game
29854.description:
Critical Acclaim - The Acting Game is essentially a game of fun designed to allow you to lose your inhibitions while revealing those acting talents that have been lying dormant perhaps for years.

The aim of the game is to be the first to collect a predetermined number of points. These are collected as players move around the board performing tasks that are rated for acting excellence by the other players. The highest rating that can be given to the performance is worthy of "Critical Acclaim".

29855.name: Schneller Becher
29855.description:
From the Rulebook:
“Yummy ice cream!” “Strawberry, chocolate, vanilla….!” Ice cream man Mario whoops with delight. The children are fascinated as they watch him skillfully fling the scoops of ice cream into the sundae. How on earth does he do that? They beg him to repeat the feat. But Mario thinks of a better idea, “Come and try it yourself!” The little ice cream lovers don't
need a second invitation and in no time the scoops zip through the air!

Contents

1 sundae (= tin)
5 scoops of ice cream
5 sundae cards
49 ice cream cards
Set of game instructions

29856.name: Stars Our Decimation, Ground Zero
29856.description:
THE STARS Our DECIMATION is the name for a series of interrelated science fiction wargames built around the actions mechanic. TSOD games all feature hand-built rules, hex grid regulated movement, a unique actions system, and versatile unit design rules.

Ground Zero is a tactical ground combat game, best suited to running company-level combats. Rules are based strongly on another game in the series - Voidstriker

29857.name: Sports Yesteryear
29857.description:
The object of Sports Yesteryear is to accumulate 100 points to your credit and have no cards left in your hand.
Players roll dice and move around a board answering trivia questions in the following categories: Baseball, Football, Mixed bag and Terminology. Each card has a point value and each correct answer adds that amount to your over all score. Each incorrect answer deducts that amount from your overall score.

From the box: "The Number One Sports Trivia Game In America"

29858.name: Traverse
29858.description: Traverse is a word-finding puzzle game played on a 4x4 grid, similar to Boggle, but it uses 16 Scrabble-like tiles instead of d6 lettered dice.

29859.name: Who Took The Cookie from the Cookie Jar? Game
29859.description:
From the back of the tin:

"The ever popular children's rhyme "Who took the cookie from the cookie jar" is now a game that even pre-readers can enjoy. Players travel around the cookie board and must either "give a cookie", "take a cookie", or say "not me"! Players actually choose their cookies from the special cookie jar shaped package. First player to collect 3 unique cookie playing pieces wins!"

- No Reading Required
- Promotes Interaction
- Easy to Learn and Play

29860.description:
(from Compass Games website:)

After failing to defeat the invading Japanese forces on the beaches of Luzon, General MacArthur, commander of United States Army Forces in the Far East (USAFFE), retreated the Philippine Army to the Bataan peninsula and Corregidor, according to War Plan Orange. Holding fortified positions and bolstered by the crack Philippine Scouts, the Allied forces would hold for months against the well equipped and trained Japanese invaders.

Bataan! is a two-player game, recreating the battle for the peninsula. Vance von Borries has drawn from his game design experience to create a game engine capable of portraying the tense jungle-fighting which took place on Bataan. While the system is based on a previous success, the changes needed to simulate the fighting on Bataan make this a unique gaming experience.

Japanese forces will move quickly to out-flank and pry the US/Filipino units from their fortifications. Yet the Americans can successfully launch attacks out of these strong points, particularly when the crack Philippine Scouts are in the lead. From time to time a player may lead with his armor and this was the one battle of the war where the lowly US Stuart tank was the superior tank!

A chit-pull system is used to randomly determine activations for the various formations on each side. In general, formation size is based on a division. Each formation activates individually for movement and combat. Players alternate activations based on the random chit-pull until all formations have played. Most Japanese formations receive two activations per turn, thereby demonstrating their combat capabilities, preparedness and motivation in taking an offensive role. Individual unit counters represent battalions or half battalions, and include efficiency ratings for combat comparisons and other functions.

Bataan! features five scenarios. The three early scenarios, which include a learning scenario, all play to a conclusion in one sitting. They feature a surprising amount of movement for a mostly jungle warfare game and rely on sound military tactics. Only the fourth scenario, the last battle, is a true set-piece action. The Japanese planned it that way and yet even the outcome of that battle was not pre-ordained. All scenarios are tied together by a campaign scenario where both players contend with supply and disease to field the best force possible for the final offensive.

Components:

1 map – 22” x 34” - [scale of 1.2 km to the hex]
2 full sheets of 0.6” counters [or 408 5/8 inch counters]
11 full-color set-up and player aid cards
1 rules booklet [with historical notes]
1 10-sided dice
1 full color box and lid set




Designer: Vance von Borries
Developer: Mark Guttag
Artist: Tim Schleif


(BGG user description:)

Bataan! is a two-player operational level game of this WW II Pacific theater campaign, January through April 1942. It presents a fascinating contest of two mismatched armies on a subject our hobby has not gamed often. The US/Filipino defense, embattled, isolated and led initially by Gen. Douglas MacArthur, for three months held off a numerically inferior but well-equipped and very aggressive Japanese force led by General Masaharu Homma. While the US and Filipino forces can be said to have won most of the first contests: the Abucay Line, the Battle of the Points and the Battle of the Pockets, it would be the final contest that decided the issue. Only because of continued complete isolation would the US lose that final battle in April 1942. And yet it was that heroic defense of sublime courage that helped motivate the US to endure the reverses of the war and persevere to a complete victory. It was "Why We Fight."
29860.name: Bataan!

29861.name: What Do You Know About The Government
29861.description:
This is a 'Facts worth knowing' Game

What Do You Know About The Government from Milton Bradley copyrighted in 1939.

Game comes with 100 Questions and answers about the U. S. Government.

29862.name: Home Court Basketball
29862.description: Card driven Basketball game from 1955. The cover has a picture of Charlie Eckman a National Basketball referee who became the head coach of the Zollner Pistons. Charlie was featured in the Saturday Evening Post, Time, and Sports Ilustrated.

29863.name: Ruby Rush!
29863.description:
In Ruby Rush, the players represent prospectors trying to cash in on a sudden up-cropping of rubies in the nearby landscape, while deterring the opposition.

The deck is 26 cards, and every card has a ruby value. Most of the cards are action cards that allow players to "Dig" up more cards, steal from other players, etc. Being too greedy can result in a cave-in, eliminating the player from the game. When the deck is exhausted, the remaining players total their rubies, and the highest value wins; or if all but one player is eliminated, that player wins immediately.

The skill sets involved are risk management, and to a lesser degree, card-counting and bluffing.

Game rules include a variant for 4-5 players with the addition of another set of cards with the same game play.

29864.name: de Berend Boudewijn kwis
29864.description:
"De Berend Boudewijn Kwis" was a very popular quiz-show on the Dutch television during the early seventies.
This game contains 100 cards with questions and three possible answers (A-B-C). If you got it right, you earn plus-points (1 for A, 2 for B, 3 for C). If you got it wrong, the points are subtracted of your total.
You can play against time, or to obtain a certain amount of points.
Questions like:
- When did the Titanic sink?
- In which country was gunpowder invented?
- What year was Kennedy shot?
- How fast can a pigeon fly?

29865.description:
Expands Warhammer Ancient Battles

Shieldwall - Warfare in the Viking Age, 790 to 1085 AD, is a 96-page sourcebook for Warhammer Ancient Battles. It contains a historical background and chronology outlining the important events as well as 28 detailed regional army lists for the Viking Age including:

Armies of the Norsemen
Including the Viking armies of the Danish, Norwegians and Hiberno Norse.

Armies of the English
Including the Saxon armies of Wessex, Mercia, and Anglia.

Armies of the Caledonians
Including the Scots and the Picts.

Armies of the Welsh
Including Gwynedd and Powys.

Armies of the Irish
Including Munster, Leinster and Ulster.

Armies of the Western Franks
Including the armies of the Carolingian French and Duchy of Normandy.

Hire mercenaries from the Dogs of War list to compliment your army
Including the Gall Gaedhil - the Sons of Death and mercenary Sergeants from Italy or Northern Spain.

Shieldwall also contains a set of new scenarios and a narrative campaign system to re-fight the warfare typical of the Viking Age, as well as detailed notes on wargaming tactics, and collecting and painting the armies of the Viking Age.
29865.name: Shieldwall

29867.name: Auf hoher See
29867.description:
The game is played on 7×7 grid game board. The 4 corner spaces are the home harbours, where the players start with their ship. The 45 other spaces form the sea, which is filled with 45 wave chips. A red(!) pirate ship is placed in the middle of the board.

The harbours contain 3 of 4 merchandise with prices that are defined by a dice throw at the beginning of the game. A player can load his ship with up to 2 merchandise and must deliver them in another harbour than they are bought from.

Each turn, a player must make 3 moves: 1 wave, his ship and the pirate ship. Waves are stacked upon each other, ships cannot jump over other ships. Movement is determined by the number of waves and playing pieces on the starting space, but a wave must be left back at every crossed space during a move. In this way, the waves shift constantly over the sea giving a really floating sea feeling.

Winner is the player who has earned a previously fixed amount of gold pieces the first.

29868.name: Pension Munter
29868.description:
The game "Pension Mutter" was included in Spielbox 1/90 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series.

The board depicts a hotel lobby showing the reception desk and the key cabinet. The game can be played with a 32-card Skat deck or with 32 self made cards: 11 hotel key cards, 11 guests, 8 move cards, 1 concierge and 1 guest book card.

Object of the game is to find the correct (hidden) keys for the 11 guests that will enter the lobby during the game. The concierge (Jack of Hearts) acts as steering element for the keys. The guests will appear randomly from the 19 card deck containing the move and guest cards.

Winner is the player who has collected the highest number or guest/key pairs.

29869.description:
The game "Wellen-Halma" was included in Spielbox 4/90 as part of the "Spiel im Heft/Game in the zine" series. It is played on a 8x8 grid board with 5 specially marked 2x2 squares.

Each player has 12 playing pieces which are placed on the board at fix positions. 4 neutral pieces complete the starting position with all 28 pieces on the board.

Object of the game is to either occupy one of the five 2x2 squares with his own pieces or form one of 2 special pentagons anywhere on the board. The neutral pieces can be counted as own pieces by both players.

Each turn, a player can move a playing piece either 1-2 straight spaces in one of the 8 directions or by making a chess-knights move.

The name "Wellen-Halma" (="Wave checkers") comes from what follows after a playing piece has moved: all adjacent playing pieces are moved away for 1 space, if the are not protected by pieces behind them!
29869.name: Wellen-Halma

29870.description:
The Here I Stand: 2-Player Diplomacy Deck allows two players to go head-to-head as the Papacy and the Protestants, with the four other major powers continuing to influence the game. 19 new cards in this expansion.
The rule adjustments for this variant run about 3 pages. Playing time for experienced players is under 3 hours.

Issue Nr19 of RBM's C3i Magazine includes the variant. It is the first set of playing cards ever published with the Magazine (other than Rise of the Luftwaffe cards that needed to be cut apart for use).

This variant is also included in the deluxe edition of Here I Stand.
29870.name: Here I Stand: 2-Player Diplomacy Deck

29871.name: Der Pate
